story:
About Sharon Watts:

Growing up, all I wanted was to draw and move to NYC. Somehow, I did!  

I went to Parsons School of Design, which led to a career in fashion illustration that spanned the decades and gave me the opportunity to flex other creative muscles. However, just as technological pace was rapidly accelerating, I felt the need to slow down and pursue more personal art. 

In 2001, I moved upstate to do just that. On September 11th, my priorities changed. The world got crazier and noisier, while I found myself wanting to get smaller and quieter—and more meaningful with my pursuits. Now I go down rabbit holes and discover all kinds of things that inform and inspire me—and want to share with you.

Most of my creative ideas are not easy to fit in an elevator pitch, and even if I tried, I'd be tongue-tied. So, let's pretend we are sitting at a cafe and sharing our labors of love. 

Where the money will go:

Book publishing (including Print-On-Demand set-up) and a bulk order that is currently taking up space in my hallway (and on my credit card bill). These books are available now for events, brick and mortar stores, promotion, mail orders—and YOU!  If I don't meet my goal, your kind support will still help immensely! 

Perks:

The book! Fun and informative, with over 60 pages of full-color illustration and a section of footnotes and facts that will either cement your trivia knowledge or serve as a primer for the Psychedelic Sixties, when we all wanted to give peace a chance.

Postcards of Woodstock-era icons Jimi Hendrix and Janis Joplin—artwork created by me.

A customized, stylized portrait of you or someone in your life. 

Note that perks will be sent out as close as possible to the request. 

Can't contribute? 

I am usually in this position, myself, so I know! I do limited social media (remember, my quest was to slip into the slow lane of life), so any way you can spread the word is much appreciated. You can share this link, or tell your friends and family that—HEY! Woodstock's 50th anniversary is this year, let's celebrate! Or just send me a note saying "Peace!"

story:
Overview

We have nearly finished writing our book on how to find love in abundance!

Over the last twenty years, we have lived a polyamorous life. Our last book, The Polyamory Toolkit, was all about tools people can use to address the common issues and deeper aspects of a polyamorous relationship. This time, we reflect on the two decades we have been dating - both as individuals and as a couple. This book is all of that experience shared with you! 

Topics

Find out all the in's and out's of online dating; polyamory specific sites for dating; real time dating tips and tricks; where to meet people; how to create a profile that gets attention (and how to keep attention once someone notices you); pandemic dating; dating for an introvert; and lots more! 

Plus what is the truth about dating if you are already an existing couple? Can it work? Should it be discouraged? Or can it be done ethically and as a positive for all involved? 

The book is 90% written! This campaign is to get us to published and in peoples hands! 

  • Our target is to raise $3,000 for our professional editor, cover artist, and publishing cost.
  • Your contribution not only gets us there, but gets you rewards! 

The Polyamory Dating Guide is nearly done!  If we reach out campaign funding amount, we will hit our timeline and have it in contributors hands by December 10, 2020! The only risk to your contribution is a possible delay - we will be publishing regardless! 

Having the support and “pre-ordering” books through donation will let us launch quickly and successfully. And you get some cool perks! 

When you back this campaign, you'll receive: 

The completed book (physical, digital, or both) of course! Plus, you can grab a journal to help keep track of all those successful dates, a bookmark that tells other people you are poly friendly,  a copy of our book, The Polyamory Toolkit, and if you are feeling adventurous, a deck of our best selling Kink Starter cards for exploring fun and naughty intimate times! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can't contribute and that is ok! But can you help in other ways? Share this to your social media feed! Help us get the word out!

story:
Sales Success Stories - The Book (Volume 2)

After a successful crowdfunding campaign to raise the money to produce the first volume of this book series, it’s time to do it again! This more direct model allows us to better fund all of the up-front expenses related to putting together a professionally produced ebook, paperback book, hardcover book and audiobook without giving up large percentages to Amazon, Audible and the like. More importantly it allows us to involve you in the process and share tons of behind the scenes details and early bird access through advance review copies.

It also allows us to thank many of the contributors who make the project possible, by name, IN the book!

My name is Scott Ingram and I'm the host of the Sales Success Stories Podcast. This is my passion project as I'm also a quota carrying sales professional, and am always looking for ways to improve myself and my own sales results.

The driving force behind the podcast and these books is the desire to create practical and inspirational content for sales professionals, by sales professionals. But not just any sales practitioners. Every guest on the podcast and contributor to the book is a quota carrying seller who is either the #1 top performer on their team, or is in at least the top 1% on a very large sales team.

To get a really good sense of what you can expect as a result of this campaign, you can take a look at the first Sales Success Stories book, or the more recent B2B Sales Mentors book which is really more of a sampler that contains 10 stories from the first book and 10 preview stories from this coming second volume. Most importantly take a look at what people say in the reviews of these books.

What's missing from the sales book marketplace in general is real stories from real sellers who are at the top of their game NOW talking about what's working for them. In this book you won't be preached at. Instead you'll just get to read or listen to raw, emotional stories from the best of the best about real deals and real experiences and what they've learned.

What We Need & What You Get

There are a myriad of details involved in publishing a book and audio book. Your support will help pay for the design, editing, proofreading, layout, printing and distribution of the book and the recording, editing, and distribution of the audiobook.

You can choose to receive any combination of the ebook, book, audiobook in addition to options for sneak previews of the content, opportunities to connect directly with some of the co-authors, videos from the 2019 Sales Success Summit or a ticket to the next Sales Success Summit where  you’ll be able to meet many of the story contributors in person

Need something special? Maybe a package of 37 books? Just reach out and I'll be happy to setup a custom perk for you.

ALL Contributors of $50 and above will get their name in the book AND access to a Google Doc where you can read all of the currently submitted stories right now!

The Authors

So far the following sales professionals have all committed to submitting some of their stories to the cause. All of them have appeared on the podcast and their names are linked to their respective episodes:

Nicole Miceli - Pulse Technology
Leila Mozaffarian - Zipwhip
John Reidelbach - SANS Institute
Scott Barker - Sales Hacker/Outreach.io
Carson Heady - Microsoft
Jeremy Leveille - LeadIQ
Evan Kelsay - Seismic
Jack Wilson - Cinch IT
Abel Lomas - TrustRadius
Nate Branscome - Chili Piper
Jamal Reimer - Oracle
David Weiss - ADP
Jelle den Dunnen - Sprinklr
Dale Dupree - The Sales Rebellion
Vincent Matano - Demandbase
Eduardo Baez - IBISWorld
Tracy Lim - Bluejeans

There will likely be a couple of additional contributors added prior to publication.

Shipping

Shipping in the US is included for free. International shipments will be charged an additional fee to cover the difference in cost.

Keep in mind that books are heavy and that fee quickly adds up with larger quantity orders.

Delivery

You can expect to receive access to the final ebook and audiobook via email and the final paperback book delivered to you in April or May of 2020.

If you choose to take advantage of the preview options those will likely be available 1-2 months in advance.

Should you choose to receive access to the Sales Success Summit videos you will get access to those by November, 2019, with the remaining items delivered based on the schedule outlined above.

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks. The most significant risk associated with this project is a timing risk. We’ve delivered out last two project on time and even early, though with B2B Sales Mentors (self funded, not crowdfunded) the audiobook release was delayed by a couple of weeks due to some technical glitches with our distributor.

Initially the plan was to release this book at the 2019 Sales Success Summit and a crowdfunding effort was launched to support that effort. I realized in the middle of that campaign that I'd simply committed to too much and decided to delay the book project. Everyone who contributed to that campaign received a full refund of their contributions.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not already subscribed to the podcast that's the best place to start. You can find links to all of the various ways to subscribe here.

Once you've done that, please share this campaign. Whether or not it makes sense for you to participate and contribute, please share this with your friends in sales and across your favorite social networks.

Thank you for your support of the Sales Success Community!

story:
¿Cómo voy a utilizar el dinero?


Nuestra aplicación aun se encuentra en etapa de desarrollo por lo que necesitamos tu ayuda para incluir en nuestro equipo diseñadores, programadores y los profesionistas necesarios para que nos apoyen  a desarrollarla, con el fin de encontrar el punto optimo para entregarte una aplicación especial y de gran calidad.

 

Acerca del creador:


¡Hola! Soy Alan Osorio, Coordinador del proyecto "All4u" siempre utilizó las redes sociales por lo que estoy consiente del tiempo que perdemos actualizando cada una de nuestras redes, para compartir momentos importantes para nosotros, por lo que esta aplicación tiene como objetivo que tú puedas disfrutar al máximo cada momento.Tengo una carrera tecnológica en computación, soy emprendedor, y tengo un gusto extraordinario por la tecnología y la innovación.  
 

¿Cómo y cuándo se entregarán las recompensas?

Una vez que lleguemos a la meta que hemos establecido y confiando en que lo lograremos con tu ayuda, se hará la entrega de las recompensas en el mes de marzo del 2017 y se estarán completando estas después del lanzamiento oficial de la aplicación.

¿Cuáles son los riesgos del proyecto?

Uno de los riesgos de nuestro proyecto es que no alcancemos la meta que nos hemos propuesto por lo que no podríamos seguir con el desarrollo de la aplicación.

story:
Story of My Book

Black Excellence: Journeys of Success stems from one man’s exploration into what excellence is and how to achieve it. Black Excellence contains the results of interviews with dozens of African American professionals who have demonstrated excellence in their lives and careers.

My name is Lynnewood Jeff Shafer II, and I am the author of Black Excellence: Journeys of Success. I wrote this work because I wanted to share stories of success within the black community to help institutionalize the wisdom of current and previous generations so future ones can go even further. 

I hope that, in reading this book, you will discover practical insights on how to be more effective in your personal journey of excellence. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same passion and excitement that I have for excellence (continual growth and development). Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you execute on things you considered impossible.

In this book, you'll learn how to become a student of life and methods for developing confidence and dealing with impostor syndrome. You'll hear stories such as...

  • How a woman who taught herself to code as a young girl while growing up in Nigeria during the Boko Haram regime, with occasional help from someone from India that she met online, grew up to become a serial entrepreneur and franchisor.
  • How an intelligent, former wall street banker with degrees from Yale and Harvard Business School developed and battled Impostor Syndrome.
  • How a man survived the Rwandan Genocide as a child to become an ivy league educated, corporate attorney.

You will love this book if you are committed to self-improvement, believe that it is wise to learn from others’ experiences, or if you love celebrating black success.  

Black Excellence: Journeys of Success is a nonfiction book that speaks to the tired, the hungry, and those ready for change. Black Excellence offers inspiration and motivation through a black lens.


What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021. 
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I publish this summer.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. 


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Lynnewood Jeff Shafer II is a JD Candidate at the University of Pennsylvania and MBA Candidate at the University of Michigan Ross School of Business. Prior to graduate school, Jeff worked as a CPA at PwC, a professional services firm, for six years.

Jeff wrote this book because the tragic death of Kobe Bryant at 41 years old, in combination with the challenges experienced in 2020 and earlier, impressed upon him the brevity of life and the importance of taking action now. Given the uncertainty of life, as Jeff and his wife prepare to welcome their first child into the world this summer 2021, Jeff wanted a book of practical life lessons that he could give to his son. Jeff considers Black Excellence to be required reading for his son and believes if we practice the insights contained within, anyone can experience improved performance in their lives. 

Jeff is a huge NBA fan and has retired from GOAT (greatest of all time) debates, since Michael Jordan is the GOAT.  Jeff and his wife are fans of great restaurant suggestions. They love traveling to exotic locations and look forward to going on their next adventure! 

For more information, you can connect with Jeff at ljeffshafer.author@gmail.com and at https://www.linkedin.com/in/ljeffshaferii/ or https://www.facebook.com/LJSIILJSIII.


International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.


Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will work with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your

story:
Story of My Book

Emergent Lives: How to Positively Disrupt Your Life focuses on the themes of uncertainty and emergence. From “what do you want to be when you grow up” in childhood to “what is your purpose in life” in adulthood, there is so much pressure to attain something, when the best part of life is the journey and the “whos” and “hows” along the way. I want to share stories of successful individuals who were adaptable in their purpose and empower others to be adaptable, too, as I have over the last two years.

My name is Rebecca Beagan and I am the author of Emergent Lives: How to Positively Disrupt Your Life. I wrote this book because I started noticing a pattern in conversations with friends, family, and colleagues. The theme was a feeling of discomfort in not knowing what they wanted to do in life (which often is thought to equate to who one wants to be or their life purpose). The more I thought about this, the more I heard it. At the same time, I heard from and read about highly successful people who took a different outlook, embracing change and emergence in their life. I think we all need to take the pressure “to become” off of ourselves and rather embrace the ride.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover ideas for how to navigate uncertainty and to proactively and positively disrupt your life whenever you want to do so. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for experimenting my way through life in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool by providing a collection of frameworks and tactics to try at any time, by yourself or with a group. to navigate life a little differently.

In this book, you'll learn about individuals and companies that have experienced change, tragedy, and opportunity, and how they chose to move forward. A couple examples from the book include:

  • Katharine Graham - How Mrs. Graham navigated deep tragedy and insecurity and was recognized as a major influencer in American journalism and politics in the late 1900s.
  • Michelle Obama - How Mrs. Obama navigated personal discovery and disruption and is a beloved First Lady of the United States who launched an important campaign to fight child obesity

You will love this book if you enjoy reading stories about people’s lives and are interested in picking up some ideas on how to reflect and learn.

Emergent Lives: How to Positively Disrupt Your Life is a non-fiction book that speaks to people feeling a sense of curiosity about their future and people interested in trying new things and learning new skills, and especially those who are looking for an alternative to defining a life purpose for the first time.

 

The Book - Emergent Lives: How to Positively Disrupt Your Life

The book is written in 4 Parts....

Part 1 contains the introduction + Chapters 1-2. The first part of the book sets the stage by acknowledging how, when, and why we set a vision or purpose statement. But then, it also acknowledges how doing so can be problematic.

Part 2 contains Chapters 3-5. The second part of the book uses stories to bring to life when vision goes wrong, when lack of vision goes right, and when vision emerges. You will learn part of the stories of incredibly interesting people and organizations and the gritty way they got to where the are or did.

Part 3 contains Chapters 6-9. The third part synthesizes takeaways from the stories in part 2 and then provides frameworks and tactics for groups and individuals to use to navigate life differently than setting a vision.

Part 4 contains Chapters 10-12. The fourth and final part places ethics in the frame of the book’s theme of navigating life with more adaptable purpose, emphasizing the ethical freedom in doing so. Finally, the book concludes with a summary and personal afterword by the author, telling her story of change and emergence.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in February 2020.
  • The Cover Design of my book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for my book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter.

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Rebecca Beagan is a Management Consultant at Roland Berger and Member of the Board of nonprofit Buckets of Rain.

She wrote this book because she has a passion for learning people’s stories and has a passion to share how a more experimentation-oriented mindset has transformed my life. She wants to empower others with ideas on how to navigate uncertainty and to proactively and positively disrupt their lives whenever they want to do so.

While much of her life has been driven by setting plans and goals and going full-force on accomplishing them, in the last two years, through a combination of going through a naturally reflective and exploratory MBA program and meeting a delightfully spontaneous individual, she has embraced a more adaptable and experimental mindset. One experiment was signing up to run a marathon. Many hours and blisters later, after a 40+ pound weight-loss the year before, and 26.2 miles of reflection and some tears, she crossed the finish line proudly! As a result, she’ll never not experiment in life again.

For more information you can connect with Rebecca at rcbeagan@gmail.com and https://www.linkedin.com/in/rebeccabeagan/.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #MadetoChange and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Rebecca Beagan

story:
Story of My Book

A Return to the Ashes tells the story of several characters whose paths cross at different points in time, some belonging to royal families, others belonging to poor commonfolk. These relationships are only further complicated by a cult created by the survivors of a burnt-down village, who look to subvert these power structures in a way that puts the authority back in their hands.

Fifteen years prior, a balaur burnt down a village in the mountains. After the survivors were rejected by every nearby kingdom, whether out of the monarchs’ coldheartedness or lack of resources, these refugees determined to take things into their own hands, building up their own nomadic group called “The Phoenix,” led by Lumina, a survivor who’d watched her close friends die and adopted their daughter, Citrina. Through years of recruiting street orphans and training up their people to be highly-skilled spies and assassins, they’ve found ways to stay invisible, a whisper in the wind believed by most to be a wives’ tale.

When Citrina, now one of the top assassins in the organization, catches the eye of a high-ranking officer in a kingdom, they see it as the opportunity of a lifetime to finally begin to root their power — but things get complicated after a run-in with the King.

In other lands, arranged marriages and festivals begin to take place — great causes for celebration that enthrall all involved, but force the characters to wonder if they’re really headed in the directions they want to go.

My name is Nadina Popoviciu and I am the author of A Return to the Ashes. I wrote this book because I wanted to explore moral questions, especially regarding the nuances of where true power lies, as well as when to use it. I wanted to use a genre I’ve always loved — fantasy — combined with inspiration from the stories and history of the home country that’ll always hold a piece of my heart — Romania.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover in what ways people can find power and ways to influence others through means that aren’t necessarily political. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to explore the question of the moral way to use that, while relating to flawed characters that have to come to terms with what that means for their personal life.

You will love this book if you enjoy medieval fantasy, moral questions, and a mix of action and romance. A Return to the Ashes speaks to younger and older adults who want to grapple with moral boundaries, power structures, and how relationships fit into that, in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that A Return to the Ashes inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like: How can I use the power I have within me in a moral manner? How does the conflict between interpersonal relationships and perceived purpose shift along differing viewpoints? Most importantly, how can we use these themes to create a social culture that is rooted in and focused on morality over power plays? I look forward to starting to explore these questions and beyond with my readers, as I believe these kinds of discussions can open our minds and change us all for the better.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Nadina Popoviciu is a Romanian-American student studying Statistics and Decision Science at Carnegie Mellon University. She has been creatively writing for over ten years, and has integrated the mix of Romanian and American culture and values that she grew up with to question the world around her and find meaningful ways to connect with others.

She is passionate about people over anything else, and how we can best improve ourselves as well as our community and world. For almost a decade she’s stated that she’ll have been successful if she’s managed to create more love in the world than there was when she entered it — through shifting perspectives and underlying philosophical themes, she hopes to create the conversations needed to create that sort of understanding among one another, with the aim of using that understanding to help each other when it’s needed and recognize the humanity of those who are different from us.

When she’s not studying or writing, she loves spending time playing games or joking around with friends, bouldering and working out, or traveling (during non-COVID times)!

For more information, you can connect with Nadina at npopovic@andrew.cmu.edu and at @nadinapopoviciu on Instagram, or Nadina Popoviciu on LinkedIn.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #AReturnToTheAshes and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,

-Nadina

story:
Primer borrador de contenidos

Seguramente este no sea el orden final, seguramente cambien los títulos, bienvenido el cambio (que se note que somos ágiles), pero las cosas van a ir por aquí...

  1. Ser, o sentirse, equipo de alto rendimiento es como la felicidad, es, en parte, una actitud.
  2. Por qué el Capitán América es mi superhéroe preferido… los grandes equipos ágiles son como niños.
  3. La inseguridad es el camino al Lado Oscuro de un líder… y de un equipo.
  4. Aquí tienes el que, hasta la fecha, es mi mantra para no perdernos en el camino hacia una cultura ágil.
  5. La multifuncionalidad va más allá de los conocimientos profesionales: experiencias aplicando el eneagrama de personalidad con equipos.
  6. “Nadie escarmienta en cabeza ajena” (by mi yaya). Por mucho que tú lo repitas… el equipo tiene que descubrirlo el solito.
  7. Un gran poder conlleva una gran responsabilidad. Una de experiencias, e historias de terror, con la famosa auto-organización Ágil.
  8. Historias sobre desperdicios (1). Ese gran equipo obsesionado con la Ley del mínimo esfuerzo, con maximizar el trabajo no realizado.
  9. Historias sobre desperdicios (2). Blackened: El tiempo que desperdiciáis cada día no habla… pero dice mucho de vosotros.
  10. Historias sobre desperdicios (y 3). Decálogo oscuro del desperdicio en equipos.
  11. Valor y velocidad, fuerza y honor.
  12. Las 10 peores cosas (y canalladas Ágiles) que me han dicho.
  13. El tío Kotter llevaba razón: El cambio viene de un sentimiento.
  14. ”Luke, debes desaprender lo aprendido (las creencias industriales)”. El cambio Ágil tiene un fuerte y oscuro enemigo en el cerebro.
  15. Al final le cogí cariño a trabajar con Walking Deads (a los que quiero y de los que he aprendido mucho). No todo el mundo puede ser ágil, aunque todo puede ”agilizarse”.
  16. El cambio Ágil (y cualquier otro) es como el maletín de pulp fiction: nadie sabe lo que te puedes encontrar.
  17. Lo que sí tengo claro que no hace un líder, con futuro, en un cambio Ágil.
  18. Como si volvieses a la EGB, volvamos a aprender a hablar, escuchar, leer y dibujar. Sin comunicación en un equipo... no hacemos nada.
  19. Días de pisco y machas a la parmesana. Cuando rompimos las fronteras invisibles entre equipos
  20. Si quieres mantener el cambio, aparte de un líder, vas a necesitar un entrenador.
  21. Tu futuro como organización ágil pasa por la diversidad, inclusividad y humanismo
  22. Al final, la culpa siempre es de Scrum
  23. historias...

Sobre el autor... Javier es pionero de la agilidad en España, su primer proyecto ágil en empresa fue en 2001.

Desde hace más de 12 años escribo regularmente en el blog javiergarzas.com, con más de 2200 entradas hasta la fecha. Este será mi segundo libro en crowdfunding y el 5º sobre agilidad.

He sido programador, jefe de proyecto, consultor, director de informática, diseñador (de UML y esas cosas), he pasado por casi todas las dedicaciones del desarrollo software.

En lo que refiere a formación, postdoctorado e investigador invitado en la Universidad Carnegie Mellon (Pittsburgh, EE.UU), Doctor (Ph.D.) (cum laude por unanimidad) e Ingeniero Superior en Informática (premio extraordinario) por la UCLM.

Actualmente, me dedico a ayudar a las empresas, a que hagan mejor software (en tiempo, con productividad, con calidad, y felicidad). Colaboro activamente con la empresa y comunidad 233 Grados de TI y, además, soy profesor titular de la Universidad Rey Juan Carlos (una de las Universidades de referencia en Madrid). Hasta la fecha he ayudado ya a más de 80 empresas.

Sobre 233 Grados de TI

233 Grados de TI es una comunidad y una organización concienciada en mejorar el mundo de la creación de software y de productos intelectuales. Entre sus actividades previas, 233 ha editado varios libros sobre agilidad, realizado numerosos eventos, ha hecho posible que varios líderes del movimiento ágil vengan a España, colabora regularmente con EDUCO y ha dispuesto multitud de material gratuito para difundir conocimiento (guías, infografías, etc.).

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Si no pueden colaborar... eso no significa que no puedas ayudar:

  • Difunde esta campaña y que genere eco.
  • Estas son nuestras cuentas de Twitter @jgarzas y @233gradosDeTI
story_txt:
Primer borrador de contenidosSeguramente este no sea el orden final, seguramente cambien los títulos, bienvenido el cambio (que se note que somos ágiles), pero las cosas van a ir por aquí...
Ser, o sentirse, equipo de alto rendimiento es como la felicidad, es, en parte, una actitud.
Por qué el Capitán América es mi superhéroe preferido… los grandes equipos ágiles son como niños.
La inseguridad es el camino al Lado Oscuro de un líder… y de un equipo.
Aquí tienes el que, hasta la fecha, es mi mantra para no perdernos en el camino hacia una cultura ágil.
La multifuncionalidad va más allá de los conocimientos profesionales: experiencias aplicando el eneagrama de personalidad con equipos.
“Nadie escarmienta en cabeza ajena” (by mi yaya). Por mucho que tú lo repitas… el equipo tiene que descubrirlo el solito.
Un gran poder conlleva una gran responsabilidad. Una de experiencias, e historias de terror, con la famosa auto-organización Ágil.
Historias sobre desperdicios (1). Ese gran equipo obsesionado con la Ley del mínimo esfuerzo, con maximizar el trabajo no realizado.
Historias sobre desperdicios (2). Blackened: El tiempo que desperdiciáis cada día no habla… pero dice mucho de vosotros.
Historias sobre desperdicios (y 3). Decálogo oscuro del desperdicio en equipos.
Valor y velocidad, fuerza y honor.
Las 10 peores cosas (y canalladas Ágiles) que me han dicho.
El tío Kotter llevaba razón: El cambio viene de un sentimiento.
”Luke, debes desaprender lo aprendido (las creencias industriales)”. El cambio Ágil tiene un fuerte y oscuro enemigo en el cerebro.
Al final le cogí cariño a trabajar con Walking Deads (a los que quiero y de los que he aprendido mucho). No todo el mundo puede ser ágil, aunque todo puede ”agilizarse”.
El cambio Ágil (y cualquier otro) es como el maletín de pulp fiction: nadie sabe lo que te puedes encontrar.
Lo que sí tengo claro que no hace un líder, con futuro, en un cambio Ágil.
Como si volvieses a la EGB, volvamos a aprender a hablar, escuchar, leer y dibujar. Sin comunicación en un equipo... no hacemos nada.
Días de pisco y machas a la parmesana. Cuando rompimos las fronteras invisibles entre equipos
Si quieres mantener el cambio, aparte de un líder, vas a necesitar un entrenador.
Tu futuro como organización ágil pasa por la diversidad, inclusividad y humanismo
Al final, la culpa siempre es de Scrum
historias...
Sobre el autor... Javier es pionero de la agilidad en España, su primer proyecto ágil en empresa fue en 2001.Desde hace más de 12 años escribo regularmente en el blog javiergarzas.com, con más de 2200 entradas hasta la fecha. Este será mi segundo libro en crowdfunding y el 5º sobre agilidad.He sido programador, jefe de proyecto, consultor, director de informática, diseñador (de UML y esas cosas), he pasado por casi todas las dedicaciones del desarrollo software.En lo que refiere a formación, postdoctorado e investigador invitado en la Universidad Carnegie Mellon (Pittsburgh, EE.UU), Doctor (Ph.D.) (cum laude por unanimidad) e Ingeniero Superior en Informática (premio extraordinario) por la UCLM.Actualmente, me dedico a ayudar a las empresas, a que hagan mejor software (en tiempo, con productividad, con calidad, y felicidad). Colaboro activamente con la empresa y comunidad 233 Grados de TI y, además, soy profesor titular de la Universidad Rey Juan Carlos (una de las Universidades de referencia en Madrid). Hasta la fecha he ayudado ya a más de 80 empresas.Sobre 233 Grados de TI233 Grados de TI es una comunidad y una organización concienciada en mejorar el mundo de la creación de software y de productos intelectuales. Entre sus actividades previas, 233 ha editado varios libros sobre agilidad, realizado numerosos eventos, ha hecho posible que varios líderes del movimiento ágil vengan a España, colabora regularmente con EDUCO y ha dispuesto multitud de material gratuito para difundir conocimiento (guías, infografías, etc.).Otras formas en las que puedes ayudarSi no pueden colaborar... eso no significa que no puedas ayudar:
Difunde esta campaña y que genere eco.
Estas son nuestras cuentas de Twitter @jgarzas y @233gradosDeTI

story:
Help give Anatomic Air Press a boost by buying the book!

If you contribute and buy the book, you'll most likely get a lifetime subscription to most of my one-off zines/projects. This means you'll get snail mail from me until I die! Who doesn't want to get awesome handmade creative treats in the mail?

What is Anatomic Air Press?

Anatomic Air Press was created in 2002 by me, Sinoun Chea, to showcase my creative efforts and collaboration with others. After 10 years of AAP's inception, I have published and made a handful of zines or books... but that's really just the beginning. I have too many ideas in my notebook ready to be executed and produced. Creating things take time and money, something I currently have little of. But this lack of money and time is not permanent and will change, especially with your help and support!

What am I doing?

I'm reprinting a book/zine collaboration I made a few years ago with Celso in an effort to raise money for future Anatomic Air endeavors.

What is this book/zine?

In 2007, Celso and I made a book called "Free" (except the title is actually "Free" in Cambodian, cover is shown above). Celso did the artwork and I did the writing. There are a few things written in Cambodian in it, but don't worry, it's translated. :) Read reviews about the book here. It was one of my favorite projects to share to the world and I sold the first 100 copies that I handmade in 2007-2008 pretty quickly. Celso handmade 200 copies for himself and they are pretty much gone on his end as well. Celso did a linocut for the cover and he sent me 200 covers to bind with the book. I have 100 of them left. Celso lost the linocut so we probably won't be reprinting this book any more in the future!

Why am I doing this?

Now that I'm ready to get the last 100 copies reprinted and made, I decided to actually ask for help this time. Your help will go a long way.

In the beginning, Celso and I sold the books for $5 or less. That was a ridiculous steal. You're probably wondering now why the hell am I asking for $25 a book?! I'll tell you why. First, the book is HANDMADE. Yes, I take it to the print shop to make copies, but I cut each sheet and bind the book myself. The book is 5" x 5" and has 56 pages. Some of the pages are "fold-outs" so it involves taping some of the pages. Don't forget that Celso block printed each cover! It's a lot of work, but we put a lot of love into it. We probably spend an average of 15-30 minutes printing and binding each book. This does not include the actual printing and shipping costs! The book is a true labor of love. With the money I'm raising by selling the book here on IndieGoGo, I'm going to put it towards future projects of Anatomic Air Press!

Why should you support Anatomic Air Press?

I like to make things. It's fun. And I think you may enjoy some of the things I make. There are a lot of great ideas waiting to be produced. Your support will help me produce these projects faster and it will help me continue my future collaborative efforts with others. There are some really cool things I have in the works and I want to share them with you. Below you will find what I have in mind in addition to the perks.

* If you contribute $25, I will include my next zine project called "hearing blue". It is complete, it is just waiting to be printed.

** If you contribute $50, you will also get the zine "hearing blue". I will also send you a project called "wave good hi" when it's complete. I don't want to give too many details to ruin the "surprise", but I'm pretty excited about this one! It's quite different from the rest of my projects. Another big plus is when Celso and I make a new book (continuing the story of "Free"), you will most likely get a copy of that as well! :)


Why do I try to keep Anatomic Air alive?

Because I want to inspire as many people as I can around the world with imaginative stories. With imagination and creativity, people will be more in touch with themselves and ultimately life and the beautiful world we live in. This creates positive energy and love... that is what Anatomic Air Press is all about... and I want to keep that alive forever.

 

Thank you for taking the time to read this and for your contribution to the future of Anatomic Air Press! If you'd like to see a few things I've done in the past, please check out my site: www.anatomicair.com

- Sinoun

PS. Please share this with your friends! It would mean so much to me! Thank you so much for the love.


The image below is the 11 x 17 "Anatomic Air Press" poster (and 4" x 6" postcards) you will receive if you contribute $50. Each poster will be signed by the artist, Joe Tsambiras, a very sweet and talented man.


This is the other postcard you will receive if you contribute $50. It is believed this picture was taken during the reign of King Sisowath of Cambodia (1840-1927). What you see are dancers at Angkor Wat. When I first saw this picture, it did something to me. So now I'm printing it so everyone else can have a copy.

story:
The Haven Series

 Haven is the first book in a series of three. I came up with the idea for the series over a year ago and have been working on it ever since. Now having finished the story of the first book, I will need a way to get it out to everybody and begin working on the second book. 

  • My name is Demas James Huckaba. I'm 18, a small town dreamer, and was born and raised here in the United States. I love writing, drawing, and I'm also a 1st Degree Black Belt in Taekwondo. Sci-fi stories and ideas always fascinate and inspire me.
  • My campaign is to bring an idea I have to the pages of a book for everyone. The first book is about three friends that have just graduated bootcamp and sign up so go to another planet in another dimension. The planet is accessible through a portal that scientist on Earth opened not knowing that, without the right means, the portal has to stay open for five years. This world is very hostile. It is crawling with creatures that are called Prisoners that are constantly trying to kill and escape out onto Earth. They are called Prisoners because of the shackles and broken chains on them. To prevent the creatures from going to Earth a military installation was built around the portal on the otherside. The three friends, Damien, Jd, and Peter, are sent on missions to learn more about this planet and possibly discover a end to the war to keep these monsterous creatures inside this dimension. It's the first book of a three part series. It has loads of humor, action, and a bit of romance.
  • Contributing is greatly helpful and much appreciated. Every contribution helps take the world of Haven a step futher. The more money we get the more we will be able to do. Every contribution will get us a step closer to getting this book out for everyone to read. If more than the goal amount is achieved then we'll produce different editions and start on other Haven projects including the second book and possibly a professionally done art book illustrating the world for you. Also, the money will be used to have the book edited by a professional. There are so many possibilites and it will mostly be decided by the contributers. Once the goal is reached I will start discussions with you as a whole and see what you want to see next.

What We Need & What You Get

I've made an esitmate of $5,000. This would get me about 450 paperback copies of Haven and leave enough money to ship rewards to my contributers. All of the money will go to the book but if enough is raised I'll have to use a little for living expenses. My laptop is all I had to write and it has crashed. So if enough money is earned I would get me a desktop computer to keep writing and creating new content for you. All that I can do is soley based on how much is contributed.

I've made 8 total perks for contributers. Ranging from a thank you card to 5 signed books, all printed and signed pieces of concept art, a thank you note, and a signed hardback special edition of the book along with a phone call from the author. 

Even if I don't reach my entire goal, all the funds will still go to the book and making it a better experience for you.

The Impact

As already explained, every contribution will make a difference but why should you contribute? This book is a completely original idea from the author and if you contribute then it is because of you that this book will be able to get out into the world. Another world will be able to open up into ours.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can contribute and want to help in some way then please try following the following ways to help:

  • Tell everyone you know
  • Share it on Facebook, Twitter, etc.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools
  • Most importantly... Make some noise!   

Want to Find Out More?

We have our own Facebook page for the Haven series. It includes artwork, updates, and even a teaser for the first book. Check it out!

https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Haven-Series/269257986512404

story:
8 years and going strong!

The Denver Zine Library (DZL) first opened its doors on December 5, 2003 thanks to the hard work of some dedicated volunteers. Since then, the DZL has moved locations a few times and is now housed in the incredible 27 Social Centre. We are an all-volunteer run, 501(c)(3) nonprofit lending library with over 10,000 donated and cataloged zines on our shelves! We've been grateful for the amazing support over the years from zinesters, community members and rad touring folks who have come through and really promoted the power and importance of zines. Read more about the DZL's history!

The power of zines

Over the years, the Denver Zine Library has hosted events and workshops, teaching youth, students and community members how to give power to their own voices. When so many of us do not see ourselves reflected in mainstream media, zines give us the ability to tell our own stories and to personally connect with other people. This connection is what makes this medium so exciting! We can find folks who share our experiences and our interests.


We need your financial support to help maintain the DZL as well as give us the ability to plan the next Denver Zine Fest! The Denver Zine Fest has brought together local zinesters, artists, poets as well as folks from around the country to showcase, sell and trade their zines.


What We Need & What You Get

The DZL is asking for your financial support to maintain and expand what we can offer our community, both in the Denver area as well as the zine community at large. Sponsor a zine workshop (at community centers, libraries and classrooms) for $50. Cover the cost of one month's rent for $100. Help us raise at least $500 towards the planning of the next Denver Zine Fest! Spread the word to your friends and pen pals!


For your fabulous support, check out the perks on the right of this page!


Want more information? Check out our website or e-mail us at denverzinelibrary@gmail.com to be added to our monthly e-mail list or find out how to volunteer!


Want to add your zine(s) to our collection? Send them our way!
Denver Zine Library
PO Box 13826
Denver CO 80201

Check out our videos for the campaign!

story:
Update!

Since we made our goal with 2 days to spare, we decided that y'all deserve a little something special! 

You can Pre Order your copy of SightShift! Select the $15 reward and you'll get the SightShift book two weeks before it hits Amazon and at a price lower than you'll ever see it! 

Our way of saying thanks!

Who You Are Determines Everything Else

I learned an idea the hard way. And I want to save you some pain. What started wtih me teaching this material to myself and others grew into leading retreats. From there it's been more retreats, speaking, and launching a church. 

I also wrote a doctoral dissertation on this idea.

This idea gave me enduring passion and focus in every area of my life.

I learned that I built who I was around what I did and what others thought of me. I did this in the midst of a growing young family and leading in the church.

I want to lay out for you with clarity the process God uses to help us build who we are around Him. And when you learn who you are you have clarity about what you must do in the world. All the pain and hurt from your past doesn't have to be buried but instead understood in the grand narrative of who God is building you to be. 

I need your help to get a book written on this idea. I'm still pastoring but I'm not teaching any college classes this summer. Your support will get me across the finish line and help release a premier resource on identity. 

What We Need & What You Get

There are 4 main uses for the funds:

  • time for me to write
  • editing help
  • layout and design
  • funding the rewards for the awesome folks like you that help make this project happen!

The Impact

Your support will make this difference:

  • You'll keep me alive. I feel like I might die (or at least explode) if I don't get this book written.
  • Last summer I wrote a dissertation. I feel like momentum is in my favor to capitalize on that momentum this summer. You can partner with me in seeing lives changed. 
  • You'll always share in this moment of getting this critical message out into the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t support financially, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Make some noise! Share (facebook), share (twitter), and share (email) this page. Heck, instragram and vine it too! 
  • Pray. I need all you've got.

Click to Tweet About the Campaign

Click to Share on Facebook
story_txt:
Update!
Since we made our goal with 2 days to spare, we decided that y'all deserve a little something special! 
You can Pre Order your copy of SightShift! Select the $15 reward and you'll get the SightShift book two weeks before it hits Amazon and at a price lower than you'll ever see it! 
Our way of saying thanks!
Who You Are Determines Everything Else
I learned an idea the hard way. And I want to save you some pain. What started wtih me teaching this material to myself and others grew into leading retreats. From there it's been more retreats, speaking, and launching a church. 
I also wrote a doctoral dissertation on this idea.
This idea gave me enduring passion and focus in every area of my life.
I learned that I built who I was around what I did and what others thought of me. I did this in the midst of a growing young family and leading in the church.
I want to lay out for you with clarity the process God uses to help us build who we are around Him. And when you learn who you are you have clarity about what you must do in the world. All the pain and hurt from your past doesn't have to be buried but instead understood in the grand narrative of who God is building you to be. 
I need your help to get a book written on this idea. I'm still pastoring but I'm not teaching any college classes this summer. Your support will get me across the finish line and help release a premier resource on identity.

story:
Hi, my name is Matt, and I sincerely thank you for taking a look at my campaign to raise funds for a first book.  Essentially these funds will allow me to live independently, continue working at both of my entrepreneurial gigs (running a handyman service and helping small business owners access funding,) and not starve or be evicted while I write and shop the manuscript to publishing houses.  I suspect that I'll be ready to publish in about six months.

My background is admittedly very eclectic.  I am a US Army Infantry veteran diagnosed with depression and bipolar disorder.  My professional history includes some nonprofit work with developmentally disabled adults, several years of audio engineering and sound reinforcement, eight years as an executive recruiter working with some of the most well-known names in the corporate world like Google, Yahoo!, Alcoa, Wal-Mart, Goodyear, Chanel, and General Mills, and since the economic meltdown of 2008, I've been working for myself - first opening a handyman business, simultaneously performing as a singer/songwriter playing solo acoustic shows around Houston, and then starting up a healthy vending business with my then-fiancee'.  I would like to start a nonprofit organization at some point but want to start writing this book whilst all the experiences of the last year and a half are rather fresh in my memory.

In a nutshell, my life was turned upside down by a woman.  She was the love of my life, my very first girlfriend in high school - she was four years older than I, and we naturally went our separate ways when she headed off to college and I was still stuck dealing with acne and how to skip Biology and smoke pot in the parking lot without being caught.  But in the middle of 2010, we reconnected via that modern marvel of cat videos and culinary photography, Facebook.  She was moving back to Texas and wouldn't it be great to get together?


Well, things picked up right where they'd suddenly stopped back in the mid-80's, and before I knew it, we were living together, along with her eighteen-year old daughter.  My book will tell some details about this peculiar and fast-moving arrangement, but will primarily deal with our breakup itself and the aftermath, and why since then it's been one seemingly insurmountable hurdle after another to reclaim my life and something resembling sanity. 

From a voluntary inpatient stay at the VA hospital mental health ward, to multiple jobs being plucked out from under me by shady small businessmen and unscrupulous shysters, from a mysterious car accident that is to this day unexplainable, to dealing with a family who not only doesn't understand mental illness but is always ready to assume the worst of people, from the emotional rollercoaster of constant adjustments to psychotropic medications and dosages, to humorous interactions with possible love interests who have no idea what kind of special hell I'm going through, it has been a long, strange, sometimes hilarious, sometimes grueling, always entertaining trip.  Along the way, there is a lot of interesting information I'll share about the nation's fourth-largest city, our beloved "Petro Metro," one of the strangest and most contradictory towns on earth.  Being lavished with praise by the business press for its supposedly strong economy doesn't even begin to tell the whole story of Houston's crony capitalism, nouveau riche attitudes and gratuitous displays of wealth and greed, dependence on undocumented labor and narcissistic underbelly.

In any case, I'm certain that in this day and age, with all the economic uncertainty, all the horror stories on the news about children being raped and held hostage for decades, and all the holy wars and terrorism and political posturing, my book will be a success.  People need to hear that others have the same kind of money problems, the same career challenges, the same issues with relationships and family, and go through the same emotional train wrecks all over the world.  People need to be reassured that no matter how many odds are against them, regardless of how bleak life may look at times, maintaining a sense of humor, even if it is only to wonder at the absurdity of it all, is essential to perseverance and ultimately, triumph. 

My goal is to write a moving story that is accessible, funny, ridiculous, maddening, joyful, gut-wrenching, and in the end, a validation of the hell we all put ourselves through just to get out of bed every day.  If you've read Dave Egger's breakout novel A Heartbreaking Work of Staggering Genius, then you know precisely what sort of novel I am going to write.

If I don't achieve my goal of ten thousand dollars to write this tome, I will still do my best to find the time to get it done.  The funding is simply a way to ensure that while writing, I don't need to clutter my life and mind with some inane job (which is apparently the only kind you're allowed to have once you spend a few years working for yourself.) I will still support myself with handyman work and helping small business owners access financing.

All I can promise to contributors in return for their generosity is that I'll be happy to send you a free signed copy once the book is published, and if it's a runaway success, I'll just go ahead and send you your donation back with 15% interest.  If you can't contribute but this sounds like a worthwhile cause, please pass this information along to a friend.  It's been a crazy, tumultuous last fifteen months, and it isn't getting better anytime soon, but I promise this book will be amazingly therapeutic for me and one hell of a read for you!


Thanks again,
Matt

story:
About the Project

Defying Gay Gravity was initially written as my own personal response to fulfilling on a childhood regret: coming out as a kid in middle school. Instead, I waited until years later when I felt safe and self-assured that it was a step I was willing to take. The book however transformed into the personal journey of Gordi and how he comes to accept himself for who he is: a gay boy looking to find a place for himself in the world.

Students around the ages of 13 and 14, who are struggling to come to terms with their own identity, will really find that Gordi’s voice is relatable. Drawing on their own personal experiences and finding ways to confront and face some questions that they are dealing with, as students or kids, this book can serve as a guide to help them navigate through this challenging part of their lives—LGBTTIQQ2S (Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transsexual, Transgendered, Intersex, Queer, Questioning, or Two-Spirited) or not.

Providing a platform for the discussions to take place, and having the hard conversations is what it’s about.

Who We Are

February 2012 marked the beginning of this project.

My name is Greg Kentris, and I’ve been a teacher here in the Greater Toronto Area for six years now. As a kid and now as an adult, I am committed to building and maintaining safe and inclusive spaces for all students, especially those who are LGBTTIQQ2S.

Over the past 16 months, we have had an amazing group of people who have jumped on board to get this book out to meet the people. Editors, Intellectual Property Lawyers, a series of Graphic Designers, Videographers, Artists, Teachers hosted through a number of focus-group sessions, and Families willing to read this book and provide feedback… that this book is so much more ours than it is mine.

It’s our shared commitment to knowing that actions are what makes the difference.

Buying a book and having conversations with your students or youth will help bring Gordi’s experience off the pages, and into the lives of our children.

What We Need

250 books, in 45 days. That’s our goal. Anything beyond that would be amazing!

So much of the work that went into building this book was thanks to the people, the professionals, who used their trades to help bring this project to life. The skilled, talented, and amazingly gracious people offered so much more of themselves that I could have asked for, at a fraction of the cost.

By supporting this project, you are not merely buying a book and paying for the printing costs. You would be giving back to those who worked tirelessly in the background, and would be helping to support their continued efforts to causes like this one.

Without these people, Defying Gay Gravity would be as invisible as the students who are struggling to come out.

What You Get

Looking at the tiers to the right, whatever option you choose, what you get is the knowledge and awareness that you’re invested in children figuring out their lives for themselves. Being a guide, a coach, a support is a noble task that helps to facilitate the overall process of coming to terms with who are.

Whether you donate money to the project, procure one or more copies of the book, or donate one or several novels to others in the world, you’ll be creating a place for conversations to happen.

Defying Gay Gravity is a novel that is much more than a book: it’s a tool to helping someone get their life.

Educator’s Guide

Getting our campaign fully backed would mean that the teacher’s we have on stand-by would come together this summer to create an Educator’s Guide. This free resource would be made available on www.agooddaypress.com so that educators who plan on using the book as a read-aloud could draw on some key Language Arts or Dramatic Arts lessons to explore with their class.

The key here is being able to go deeper into the concepts addressed in the book in meaningful ways!

The Impact

Your support, your commitment to taking the actions necessary for creating a safe and loving world for generations to come is the real impact.

Being a voice for those who have lost theirs, who continue to be silenced in the various places and spaces of our world (in Canada and especially abroad), this is the real work.

By inspiring the youth of today to go out and be unstoppable allies for the cause, you are choosing to be part of an impact that cannot be measured or quantified. It can only be felt in the hearts and minds of those lives you touch.

Other To Dos:

1. Spread the word. Copy and paste this website’s URL and send it to people via e-mail who you think would be interested in participating in the project.

2. Talk to your child’s teacher or an educator about using this amazing tool as an entry point into conversations around LGBTTIQQ2S identities, at school.

3. Connect us with agencies in your community that you think might be interested in this book. We can do the follow-up, if you provide us with the contact information.

E-mail us at info@agooddaypress.com.

Questions/Where to go to get answers…

Still need some convincing?

E-mail us your queries, and we’d be happy to clarify at info@agooddaypress.com.

Truly, we’re committed to helping you reach out to the kids in your life in a meaningful way.

*International backers outside of North America, please add an additional $10 to help with shipping.

story:
This a true story
A story about the best and worst things that could have happen to me, eye opening experiences that I will never forget Gods goodness surely carried me through, life changing for me. When God says he will never leave or forsake you, and when he says do not sin and fornicate he is saying that for reasons and his commandments and order will not be comprimised, he really means that if you surrender your own will, humble yourself, I mean really cry your heart out humble yourself and then apply your gift to give him for his edification then and only then will he show up. .This book tells the captivating story of a portion of y life; I lost my husband and my eight month old son, this story is one of my testomony’s of Gods goodness and example of effective praying and unweavering faith and Love knowing what God has promised me at my most humbled moment, I understood his unconditional love. The money raisedfor the project would go to cover the production of my book as a self publisher. I thank you for what ever support you are able to bless my campainge with. Look for more books coming soon.

…"Sitting on the table of the emergancy room waiting for my results, did I have the flu or was it more serious than that. I had been feeling sick for weeks and Donald was acting real serious all of a sudden, a side of him i had not seen before. He seemed to be worried and that scared me.

The nurse came back and whiped the curtain back real fast and started smiling at me, Donald moved back to the wall and just listened and watched my expression as she said to me. Alicia, you are pregnant! My heart dropped, I was elated and never heard her explain the blood disorder she was concerned about.

Get a Prenatal Care doctor and have these test done right away, you have to take care of the baby. I looked at Donald and was hoping to see the same silly grin on his face that was on mine, but instead I saw more worry"

story:
VIDEO IS FORTHCOMING!!

Our Story

There's nothing unique about my story, Know that upfront. My name is Liz, I was raised as a whitegirl-in-the-Southern-suburbs (of NC) and I have been clinically mentally ill for more than half of my life. Treated like an untouchable outcast whose problems were shrugged off by people who didn't understand the depths of the disease, I spent most of my formative years delving into heavy belief systems regarding self-medication through varied substances and, thus, found myself immersed in a long-term, mentally abusive relationship and a mental prison of my own making. After years of this, I began turning to suicide for answers, which landed me in a mental hospital. Twice.  Fortunately, I failed even at that and, after decades of feeling alone and ostracized, I finally dropped the habits that were holding me back (drinks, stupid love choices, etc.) and started coming around to the benefits of medical health in tandem with therapy. While my life is now consistently better than it ever has been in my 28 years on the planet, I still struggle with the disease, the stigmas and the uphill road that calls itself "recovery."


All this being said, I am still appalled at the amount of stigma surrounding mental issues and the very real struggle the victims and families of mental health have to endure as sudden outcasts of society. It is heartbreaking to me to see that many people view depression as a dead-end, instead of a chance to grow and become a highly-aware human being who can live the rest of his/her life happily. This frustration is the basis of my memoir's theme; the idea that I am not unique should hit home for millions of mentally ill people just as myself, who don't deserve to be lumped into categories and considered as a second class human. This is for all of us.


The Impact

What I hope to accomplish in writing my memoir is not to produce just another wah-look-at-me-I-had-depression-and-now-I'm-magically-healed-with-happy-pills cliche. What I desperately want my audience to understand is that MY STORY IS NOT UNUSUAL; that there are literally thousands of those suffering with mental illness from all walks of life whom every one of us is in contact with with on a regular basis. Mental illness on all levels is scary, yes, but every case needs love and support in its toughest times, just like any other person suffering from any other disease. We aren't something to fear or reject; we are people, too; we appreciate empathy and, most of all, intelligent discourse to help us spawn proactive change when interacting with the mentally us as productive citizens. Ultimately,I want this book to step outside the usual depression/mental-illness-based memoir and focus on how this is a problem that affects more people than we are inclined to believe. I want this to open the doors for public discussion on the matter. I want to spark debates about the over-medication of psychiatric patients. I want this to change the way society views the treatment of the mentally ill and the way we talk to and about patients of such.

What We Need & What You Get

Since 2006, this is a story that has been buried under stacks of paper that have remained untouched because of my full-time job as a mother and part-time freelance work. However, with these upcoming winter months, I dream of making this project a full-time job and completing a rough draft by Spring 2012, after which I hope to take the work through a series of edits and workshops. 

If I don't have a little outside monetary help, I can't get this book written and published. I'm constantly running after an almost-4 year old all day, I have zero publishing software, and, most importantly, I can't afford to drive around the Southeast to interview experts in the field of psychology and sociology (which is imperative if this is to be a bulletproof argument for tolerance.). The funding I am requesting will help pay for basic publishing needs, childcare on the days that I need to travel for research purposes and travel provisions while researching and networking. Ultimately, the funding will go straight toward my publication of the material, including the sending-out of the rough material to agents and the loads of legal hoops I will inevitably have to jump through in order to make this happen.

But man, oh man, am I all about sending out freebies, so don't think you'll be getting something for nothing. There will be goodies at each pledge level!
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell a friend. Tell a carpool buddy. Tell your minister. Tell your mentally-disabled friend. Tell everyone you can. I want this project to be strong, thoroughly-researched, and bulletproof when finally up against a public audience and I want this memoir to speak on behalf of the mentally ill community to incite change, whether it be in policy or in social discourse. I can use any help that may come my way, even if it isn't in monetary gifts. Right now, more than anything, I'm hoping for support for my dream to change the public face of mental illness and the reaction to such an unnecessarily taboo subject.

Treated like an untouchable outcast whose problems were shrugged off by people who didn't understand the depths of the disease, I spent most of my formative years delving into heavy belief systems regarding self-medication through varied substances and, thus, found myself immersed in a long-term, mentally abusive relationship and a mental prison of my own making. After years of this, I began turning to suicide for answers, which landed me in a mental hospital. Twice.  Fortunately, I failed even at that and, after decades of feeling alone and ostracized, I finally dropped the habits that were holding me back (drinks, stupid love choices, etc.) and started coming around to the benefits of medical health in tandem with therapy. While my life is now consistently better than it ever has been in my 28 years on the planet, I still struggle with the disease, the stigmas and the uphill road that calls itself "recovery." 

All this being said, I am still appalled at the amount of stigma surrounding mental issues and the very real struggle the victims and families of mental health have to endure as sudden outcasts of society. It is heartbreaking to me to see that many people view depression as a dead-end, instead of a chance to grow and become a highly-aware human being who can live the rest of his/her life happily. This frustration is the basis of my memoir's theme; the idea that I am not unique should hit home for millions of mentally ill people just as myself, who don't deserve to be lumped into categories and considered as a second class human. This is for all of us.


The Impact
What I hope to accomplish in writing my memoir is not to produce just another wah-look-at-me-I-had-depression-and-now-I'm-magically-healed-with-happy-pills cliche. What I desperately want my audience to understand is that MY STORY IS NOT UNUSUAL; that there are literally thousands of those suffering with mental illness from all walks of life whom every one of us is in contact with with on a regular basis. Mental illness on all levels is scary, yes, but every case needs love and support in its toughest times, just like any other person suffering from any other disease. We aren't something to fear or reject; we are people, too; we appreciate empathy and, most of all, intelligent discourse to help us spawn proactive change when interacting with the mentally us as productive citizens. Ultimately,I want this book to step outside the usual depression/mental-illness-based memoir and focus on how this is a problem that affects more people than we are inclined to believe. I want this to open the doors for public discussion on the matter. I want to spark debates about the over-medication of psychiatric patients. I want this to change the way society views the treatment of the mentally ill and the way we talk to and about patients of such.

What We Need & What You Get Since 2006, this is a story that has been buried under stacks of paper 
that have remained untouched because of my 
full-time job as a mother and part-time freelance work. However, with 
these upcoming winter months, I dream of making this project a full-time
 job and completing a rough draft by Spring 2012, after which I hope to 
take the work through a series of edits and workshops.  If I don't have a little outside monetary help, I can't get this book written and published. I'm constantly running after an almost-4 year old all day, I have zero publishing software, and, most importantly, I can't afford to drive around the Southeast to interview experts in the field of psychology and sociology (which is imperative if this is to be a bulletproof argument for tolerance.). The funding I am requesting will help pay for basic publishing needs, childcare on the days that I need to travel for research purposes and travel provisions while researching and networking. Ultimately, the funding will go straight toward my publication of the 
material, including the sending-out of the rough material to agents and the loads
 of legal hoops I will inevitably have to jump through in order to make 
this happen. But man, oh man, am I all about sending out freebies, so don't think you'll be getting something for nothing. There will be goodies at each pledge level! 

Other Ways You Can Help
Tell a friend. Tell a carpool buddy. Tell your minister. Tell your mentally-disabled friend. Tell everyone you can. I want this project to be strong, thoroughly-researched, and bulletproof when finally up against a public audience and I want this memoir to speak on behalf of the mentally ill community to incite change, whether it be in policy or in social discourse. I can use any help that may come my way, even if it isn't in monetary gifts. Right now, more than anything, I'm hoping for support for my dream to change the public face of mental illness and the reaction to such an unnecessarily taboo subject.
