story:
¿Qué?

Vivir sin mí nos sumerge en las lagunas del olvido que padece su protagonista, Belén, que incapaz de recordar quién es ni fue trata de recuperar su identidad.

La novela nos adentra en la mente de una joven con amnesia. Desde su perspectiva, aprendemos lo que es descubrir el mundo de todos y el mundo interior de cada uno, por primera vez. Acompañamos a Belén en un viaje por lugares que debería conocer pero no recuerda. Sintiéndonos como ella, perdidos en sus memorias, o más bien, su falta de ellas. Vivimos con ella mientras lucha una batalla constante por recordar.  

La autora nos abre una puerta única a las experiencias singulares que vivió, convertidas en novela para que podamos disfrutar, sufrir y aprender de cómo Belén, la protagonista de esta historia, es capaz de aferrarse al amor y la esperanza que, colgando de un hilo, son sus lazos a la vida que necesita recuperar.
 

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Inés Beamonte Cosín.

Madrileña de sangre gallega, nació en 1993. Se ha criado y ha vivido en España, México, Estados Unidos, Suiza, Inglaterra o Portugal. Inés tiene un grado en Artes Escénicas (Bachelor of Fine Arts) de la universidad The Boston Conservatory at Berklee en Boston, EEUU. Además de esta obra, sus poemas han sido incluidos en varios poemarios, incluida la revista Dichtkunst Magazine.

Actualmente es bailarina profesional en Europa y reside en Madrid.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«­—Yo estuve aquí con ella hace solo unos minutos.
          —Esta tiritando.
          —Estaba bien, vinimos las dos al baño.
          —Le sangraba el pie, creo…
          —Esperaremos a que llegue la ambulancia.
          Conversaciones, alrededor de mí. Se refieren a alguien, a ella. ¿Quién es ella? Me están sujetando, aquí, sin hablarme, como si no estuviera aquí. Viene una ambulancia. Debe de haber una emergencia. Escucha. ¿A lo mejor estoy muerta? Nadie me ha reconocido como viva. Claramente yo no puedo demostrar que estoy viva. No siento los pies. ¿Y si estoy muerta? No. No. No. Pánico. Muerta. Palabra pesada. Cuerpo pesado. No puedo estar muerta. Estoy despierta. Estoy viva, de eso, estoy segura. Respira. No puedo. Tengo agua en los ojos. No lo puedo controlar. Respira. No puedo. Mi cuerpo se esta hinchando, necesito aire, respirar. Mi pecho, me duele. Tengo que estar viva. Puedo sentir. Dolor. No habría dolor si estuviera muerta. Respira. No puedo. Escucha. Escucha. Más información, cuanta más información, más sabrás. Una voz nueva. Respira. Tienes que estar viva»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 920€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Vivir sin mí que saldría después a la venta.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción RESPALDAR es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona a la autora, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Inés Beamonte Cosín vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad

story:
Project Update: We did it!

The first-edition run of Daytripper has arrived! 150 books are being signed, numbered, packaged in 100% recycled eco-friendly packaging, and shipped out. Shipping confirmations and tracking numbers will be sent to you once they ship and I will be writing a donation check to the National Park Foundation this month.

Thank you to EVERYONE who supported the book and made this dream of mine a reality.

A limited number of first-edition copies (along with e-books and prints) remain at www.daytripperthebook.com.

 

--

Short Summary

Adventure can be yours if you’re willing to create it for yourself.  Looking for places to explore, topics to learn, and new ideas to discover, you can ensure fun, discovery and play are constants in your life. It is possible to give yourself this gift over and over, to turn your life into something incredible and amazing. 

This is the belief I tested during the summer of 2017. I quit my job, started my own business, and took off to explore the unknown. What I discovered was a deep love affair with our planet.

Leaving June 27, 2017 from San Diego, CA, my boyfriend and I would spend the next sixty days on the road living out of his car, a 2011 Hyundai Elantra Touring. Through a series of day-trips, we would explore, camp, and hike through nine states and twelve of America’s National Parks, all while I ran my business on the road and he worked remotely. To say the trip changed my life would be an understatement. It allowed me the opportunity to decompress from the stressful years I spent working in fashion in New York City. I was able to reconnect with what I love most about being human: getting to explore, learn & laugh in beautiful environments with people I love.

To share compelling stories, high-quality photographs and life-changing lessons learned from the road, I have written and thoughtfully-designed a coffee table book on the experience. My book, Daytripper: 60 Days on the Road Exploring America’s National Parks, is near launch. Working on designing this book has been amazing getting to relive every precious, magical, and hilarious moment from camping, hiking & working on the road. I can’t wait to share it with you and with the world.

The Impact

I am humbled to be a small part of the #vanlife movement. Join me as part of the community that seeks the beauty out of the mundane, the good out of the chaos, and a simpler way of living. 

Help Save Our Parks – Feel good about your contribution!

I am excited to launch this book as a community endeavor. This book isn’t just about me; it’s about all of us. The public lands are a collective gift that as humans on planet Earth, we will pass on to the generations to come. Protection of these sacred lands is not guaranteed. Assist me to help ensure their survival. On top of being printed on recycled paper and printed locally in the U.S., a portion of every book sale will go back to the National Park Foundation. 

What We Need & What You Get

I am looking to you, for help raising at least $15,000. These funds will cover the costs of design, publishing, marketing, and distributing Daytripper: 60 Days on the Road Exploring America’s National Parks to a worldwide audience. I am offering pre-orders exclusively through this campaign. I am also offering a limited run of autographed copies of the book along with autographed matted prints, perfect to decorate your home or office or to gift to the real national-park enthusiast in your life.

THE BOOK

Printed locally in the United States in Los Angeles, the 7.5" x 9.5" book will be 150+ full-color pages of high-quality photographs and compelling stories from the road. The soft-touch paperback cover will feature the book title printed in silver foil. The interior pages will be printed on recycled paper and a portion of every book sale will go back to supporting the parks.

 SAMPLE PAGES:                     

SIGNED COPIES

These first-run copies can be upgraded to include a signature and personalized note from yours truly on the inside title page.

SIGNED PRINTS

High-quality 4x6 and 8x10 ready-to-frame prints are available to add-on with your book. Frame a unique piece of Earth’s beauty captured by me in your home or office. Prints will be signed and packaged with mattes, backing & wrapped in a protective casing.

4x6 prints come in 5x7 mattes

8x10 prints come in 11x14 mattes

About the Author

My name is Kayla Clements. I am a Woman. Creative Director. Business Owner. Time Traveler. 28-Year Old. Sister. Hiker. Designer. Photographer. Lover. Friend.

With a background in the fashion & commercial photography industries in New York City, I offer a unique perspective on the outdoors and in the National Parks. Beautiful printing and design is just as important to me as sharing a compelling story. The collection of images and stories are laid out in a way to appeal to everyone, but those with a design eye will appreciate the smaller details that have gone into the book. 

Project Timeline

The past four months has been dedicated to writing, editing, designing & proofing this book. The book made it's debut at a community showcase in Los Angeles, CA on January 20, 2018. 

Risks & Upgrades

I have two prototypes in hand and the books are ready to go to press immediately once the campaign comes to an end.

With years of experience in print production, I am incredibly detail-oriented about the print quality and design of the book. I want the finished book to be something you and your guests can experience, rather than just something you can read. I have consulted with both my printer in LA and my connection at Mohawk Paper about some design upgrades that can be added to the book if we sell over 1,000 books. This is ideally how I would like the book to be printed. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I realize some people may not be able to help fund Daytripper: 60 Days on the Road Exploring America’s National Parks. You can still help bring this project to life by sharing this project with friends or family. You can share this project through Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, emails, phone calls or even to a stranger on the subway or street ;)​

Aside from the perks, if you would like to contribute a variable amount to the campaign, click "Back It" at the top of the page to make a contribution of your choice. Every dollar counts!

Learn more at www.daytripperthebook.com

Learn more at www.daytripperthebook.com

story:
Body Images: The Naked Truth:

The stories and photos of this project are from women of all ages who have taken the risk to expose their vulnerabilities, past or present, about their relationship with their bodies.  It is estimated that teenage girls are exposed to over ten hours a day of various media sources (TV, internet, magazines, music videos, etc.) that clearly place women’s value and power in youth, beauty and sexuality. Not surprisingly, women hold only 3% of the decision making roles in mainstream media, and an estimated 65% of women and girls have disordered eating behaviors.

Ultimately, our goal with this project is to shift our negative attitudes into self-acceptance and self-love so that we can influence our daughters, our nieces, our students and future generations of women. Contributors share their story about their body image, whether it is their relationship to their weight, hair, skin color or whatever issue they may face. 

By telling our story, we offer an opportunity to other women to share theirs so that we can release their grip on us.  This honest portrayal is intended as a springboard to creating female role models that do not abide by the narrow confines of media images and to inspire women and girls to step into leadership.


Looking into the eyes of the authors, the stories are accompanied by photographs taken by Andy Shelter of Andy Shelter Photography.

story:
Author of the Hoshiyan Chronicles, book 1,'Seeking the Light of Justice' (www.drbarrynadel.com). Dr. Nadel's background varies from anthropology, archeology, grapes and wine, plant breeding and plant tissue culture. He has published a number of scientific papers and reviews and has a book on home wine making. Dr. Nadel is the father of three girls and one son. He is the grandfather of 5 girls and 4 boys. 

The subjects that the series cover are ethical, moral and spiritual challenges that man has faced since creation. The book has something to teach everyone in an enjoyable action-packed adventure.

This campaign will raise the funds to publish the first book of the series and hopefully the sales will fund the publishing of the rest of the series.

The funding will be used for editing, typesetting, proofreading, graphics, printing,

marketing and sales. 

There are perks for those who donate from copies of the e-book, to soft bound copies to hardbound copies with personalized  notations from the author. Anyone that gives $5000 will be mentioned in the dedication section at the front of the book. If someone will donate $15000 USD then I will dedicate a character in the book to them.

If I don't raise all the money, then I will concentrate most the money on getting the book published and a sales program.

This project is value because of its educational and entertainment value. The overall objective is to show that life can be lived differently. Firstly, to look at our lives in a less pathological means and not that we have 'problems', but to see them as challenges that came to teach us something. Challenges come to build us, not break us down. The book covers the spiritual journey of the team of archeologists and how what they find changes their lives.

As in any publishing endeavor, the main challenge is marketing and sales. To deal with this I have been studying over the past 4 months how other authors go about marketing and selling their books. The conclusions are"

1. Build a strong writers platform, especially a list of emails of fans and people interested, so when the book comes out they are your first market.

2. Use existing systems to piggyback on to reach large populations, like Goodread's special program for authors.

3. Build a professional website with all the information for journalists, publishers, and readers to find easily.

4. Make an e-book version and use the internet to sell it. There are a number of internet outlets for authors today.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about the campaign to your friends and colleagues .
  •  You can also use the Indiegogo's share tools to help get the word out.

story:
What is Traverse?

My name's Jacqueline. I love reading poetry. I love games. I love collecting things. And I love publishing! For nearly 15 years I’ve co-published Brittle Star, a magazine for new writers, and if I can find more ways to get good poetry out there I will.

And with Traverse I think I have!

Traverse takes all the things I love and mashes them together to produce a fresh and lovely collectable trading card for poetry. I asked some poetry friends if they could donate a poem and I was over the moon when they said 'yes'. I picked their brains for quirky bits n bobs and factoids and they still said 'yes'! So now it’s your turn to say yes and help us get this fun way of poetry publishing and collecting off the ground!


Two years ago artist Frances Barry and I launched Small Grass, a book-based crowd funding campaign to help independent publisher Stonewood Press. And you were fantastic in your support! We hoped to raise £600 but we more than doubled it, raising just under £1000 online and £300 through the post. This meant Stonewood could produce four more books.

This small press’s books are full of wonderful writing from established poets wanting to do something unusual, to small chapbooks that launch writers’ careers. Stonewood publishes hardbacks, e-books, paperbacks, chapbooks and limited editions for lovers of poetry and short fiction.


Do you want to know more? 

The first series of will be launched with BRAND NEW poems from Ian McMillan, Pascale Petit, Susan Wicks, Mimi Khalvati, Myra Schneider, Wayne Burrows, Kathryn Maris, Anna Robinson, Fawzia Kane, Jacqueline Gabbitas, Di Slaney, Paul Blake and Pippa Hennessy. And not so new but wonderful poems from Edna St Vincent Millay, William Shakespeare, William Blake, John Clare, Elizabeth Barrett Browning and Aphra Behn. And there will be a special orange Scratch n Sniff card featuring Christina Rossetti exclusive to Indiegogo supporters.

There are lots of trading cards out in the world including Artists Trading cards and Poetry Trading Cards, so Traverse will be in excellent company. Each individual card will have a scarcity level from ‘Plentiful’ to ‘Super_rare’. Some will be just about everywhere you look - even under the cushions! - some will  have shiny gold foil or coloured laquer, some will stand out and be hand embossed, and our very Super_rare card will have a microchip and QR code that takes the collector – on their smart phone - to a video of poet David Constantine reading and talking about William Blake's poem.



What do we need & what do you get?

We’re pretty down to earth and looking for only £830. This will:

  • pay for print, production and packaging of the Traverse cards
  • launch Traverse and fund a marketing and trading events campaign
  • help us to get the packs into bookshops, gift shops and book fairs

And all profits from the sale of Traverse packs will go directly back into production of Stonewood’s books (and maybe even another series of Traverse), helping the press publish even more titles this year.

Our perks start for as little as £1 for your name on our website and the warm glow of knowing you’re helping a lovely publishing press, right up to £60 for the complete set of Traverse cards, including the rare and super rare ones.


How else can you help?

If you can’t help us by donating money, please help us to spread the word! Get out your megaphones and gramophones and twitterphones and facebookophones and tell the world about Traverse – and don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools.

When can you get your hands on Traverse?

Shortly after our campaign finishes you'll receive your chosen perk - way before they get into the shops! With Traverse you can organize your poems however you want in whatever order you feel like reading - it's like having your own poetry anthology exactly as you want it.

You can also sign up to our newsletter to find out about Trading Events - where you can buy cards, swap with other collectors and listen to great poetry. Tickets for our trading events will always include a pack of Traverse cards.

Or you can even hold an event yourself. Trading events don't need to be big and glitzy - a bunch of mates grabbing a pint or a cuppa is just the ticket to share your poems and swap cards. Tell us the date and we’ll promote it on our website.

So if you like the sound of Traverse and you too love poetry, games and collecting things, help us get this fun project off the ground. Pick a card, any card and #PutAPoetInYourPocket.

story:
What is ¿Donde Esta Mi Gente?

¿Donde Esta Mi Gente? Is going to be a 3 day celebration of Latino Poets and Writers in San Francisco as part of National Poetry Month. Presented by Galería de la Raza's REGEN Artist Fund, this event will be an exciting celebration of the Latino literary voice in the Bay Area. Baruch Porras-Hernandez, the program director and curator is bringing together 22 writers, for 3 shows,  Books Inc. –on Market, on April 5ht, Magnet in the Castro on April 12th, and the last show with the largest line up will be at Galería de la Raza on April 19th.

The focus of this project is not just to showcase Bay Area Latino writers, but to foster unity, longevity and professional development for them. The program director, Baruch Porras-Hernandez seeks to not just foster public awareness of Latino writer performers by putting together this show, but to build a foundation for further intercultural and multigenerational dialogue between Latino spoken word artists. Learn more at www.dondeestamigente.com

And learn about Galería de la Raza, here! http://www.galeriadelaraza.org/

Who is Baruch Porras-Hernandez?

Baruch Porras-Hernandez is a writer and performer based in San Francisco,and is the host of the San Francisco Queer Open Mic and Performance Series. He has organized and curated several spoken word and poetry shows all over the bay area.

Participating Artists 

Alejandro Murguía,  Avotcja (Avacha),  Guillermo Gómez Peña,
Sandra García Rivera, Lorenzo Herrera y Lozano, Lito Sandoval, Harold Terezón, Denise Benavides, Jaime Cortez, Fish Vargaz, Leo Bryant, Estela de la Cruz, Dylan Amaro-Mcintyre, Maya Chinchilla, Christina Pérez, Gabriel Cortez, Kay Nilsson,
MK Chavez, Tomas Moniz, Marisela Treviño Orta, and Sarah C. Jimenéz.

What We Need & What You Get

We need 1000 bucks. (that's not a lot, come on, you love Latinos, and our food, give us money to recite poetry to you)

The money donated will go to fund

  • Filming and editing of videos of interviews with each writer and a video of them reciting their poetry. 
  • Getting some payment for the writers, there are 22 of them.
  • Marketing materials, fliers, posters, post cards. Paying the designer, and the printing and the shipping.
  • Website to host and be a center for the project and its future.
  • Photographer to make sure to document the event with some nice looking pictures.
  • A Videographer to make sure all three events are well documented.
  • Editing and maintenance of the videos on the website, of all 3 performances and all of the 22 writers.
  • Payment of Post card/poster distribution.
  • Travel stipends for writers.
  • Some light snacks for mentorship session/rehearsal, poets gotta eat!

What you get!

For supporting this great endeavor you get the satisfaction of helping out Latino Writers have a festival, and that joy should be enough.

JK! LOL! You do get some goodies! There are all sorts of prizes! You could get Poetry Books, Theatre Tickets, Passes to Tourettes Without Regrets, and you might even get Baruch Porras-Hernandez at your house for a private performance.

The Impact

This show will showcase some of the top Latino writer performers in the bay area and the focus of the project is not just to make a poetry show, but to foster unity, longevity and professional development for Bay Area Latino poets. The artistic director, Baruch Porras-Hernandez seeks to not just promote the work of Latino writers, but to get us all to connect, unite, and build a foundation for further intercultural and multigenerational dialogue between Latino spoken word artists and writers. Most importantly we hope that this becomes an annual event, and that in the future when young Latino writers ask that question ¿Donde Esta Mi Gente? (Where are my people?) they will get an answer: this festival, this show, these writers.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just come to the show! Visit the website to find out all the details about the whens and wheres!

Talk about us! Share the fb page, the website, tell all your friends.

Visit Galería de la Raza’s page and go to their events.

THANK YOU thank you THANK YOU gracias GRACIAS thank you.

story:
Ernesto

Ophelia Pena, a Spanish American researcher and animal conservationist,  living in Belleza Island, Crystea, the newly formed breakaway nation in Africa, sights a ravenous teenager, who ends up being an isolated, free, feral child, brought up by the mandrill monkeys of the island. Ophelia adopts the boy who walks with four hands and prefers sleeping on branches of trees. She names him Ernesto, and begins her long journey to make him understand human behavior and to turn him into a social animal. 

A chance discovery of the boy's monkey - like quick reflexes one day, makes Ophelia expose him to the world of football. When the coach of an amateur local club confirms that Ernesto is God's gift to African football, she vows to make him the greatest goal – keeper in history. In just a few years, Ernesto proves to be the chosen one displaying goal-keeping skills that no one had witnessed before. His career flourishes with a multi – million dollar signing of a top club from the English Premier League, and his meteoric rise makes him the flag – bearer of African football. The cruel dictator of Crystea now wants to control Ernesto, his money, his fame and his growing influence in his country. Ernesto leaves his homeland, but continues to induce power in his people through his football.  He inspires a revolution. His people shed blood, to not just overthrow their dictator, but also to get Ernesto back. After many years in England and having touched the pinnacle of football, Ernesto comes back with his mother to Belleze Island. He decides to protect his brothers; he fights the poaching of mandrill monkeys as bushmeat delicacy. 

My Short Biography                                                

I am a writer, director & producer born in India and based in Singapore. My area of work includes feature films, documentaries, scripted theatre and the improvisation - based Playback Theatre. For Playback Theatre, I received training under Jonathan Fox, the founder at the School of Playback Theatre, New York. As a Playwright and Artistic Director, my work includes the four plays; The Dressing Room, Psy-Clone, Chaplin in Love and ChanakyaShastra.  

I made my first documentary in Afghanistan in 2005, capturing the lives of the people there, four years after the exit of the Taliban. My feature film “God Lives in the Himalayas” made in 2009, was shot in the stunning backdrop of the Everest Region in Nepal. The movie was selected in several leading international film festivals. I was awarded the Best New Director for the film at the Monaco Film Festival,  2010.

In early 2010, I established “I Love My Mother Earth” Foundation to work in the area of conservation and research of our planet. The foundation has donated over 300, 000 notebooks, made from re-cycled waste, to disadvantaged children in India.

In October, 2012, I set up Rainbow Mandrill Entertainment in Singapore and am working on a film production besides my book, Ernesto.

My Mission

I am here on Indiegogo.com to raise funds to launch my first novel, the working title of which is “Ernesto”. Ernesto is a story, I believe, will fascinate everyone who loves reading books. The book is slated for a 5th June release, exactly one week before the World Cup begins in Brazil. I have been working on it for several months and my research for the book included understanding the world of feral kids, knowing everything about Mandrill Monkeys, the most beautiful species of monkeys in the planet and an in-depth study of African football. In spite of all the research, my work would be incomplete if I did not visit Africa. As a writer and filmmaker, I have learned the need for visiting a place, living there myself at least for a short while, understanding the people and their culture; before presenting a story set in any place in the world.

My first draft is ready and therefore, I decided to connect to the global community using Indiegogo.com, partly to raise funds and partly to get feedback from the world. I believe that this book could lead to the biggest success of my life so far. I have been a non-conformist, always following my dreams. My passion to make things happen in my life, has almost always paid dividends.

I need your support to be able to give the best possible finish to Ernesto. And it is important for me that I give the book what it deserves.

To achieve this, i. I need to go to Africa for 2 – 3 weeks to complete my research efforts for the book. I believe that this trip will help me add more colour and depth to my characters and thereby give a richer experience to all the readers.

ii. To pay a top – class professional copy editor who could give it the world – class finish I want to give to the book.

iii. To print a limited hardback edition of the book, one of which could be yours. 

iv. To promote and publicize Ernesto.

The USD 40, 000 I am trying to raise through this platform will go into taking care of the four things above.

How can you be involved?

I am, of course, hoping that you will make a contribution to fund the project. I think I have worked out a set of very interesting rewards or perks. In addition to the rewards, I am trying to create an unbelievable and amazing experience for the global community that I intend to create through the numerous web – based and offline activities that are planned from June 5, the launch date of the book. Wherever in the world you are, you could be leading the effort in your region. I am sure you will enjoy this process of co - creation. Unlike most projects, you will feel a great sense of ownership by joining my efforts. Ernesto is about the power of the human spirit, about Africa, about saving our planet and about football. I intend to create a marvellous journey for everyone who is willing to go on this ride with me. Your support will be the key to unlock this adventure.

If I don't reach my goal?

Reaching one - sixth will enable me to go to Africa. I am confident that the manner in which I will share my experience when I return, will inspire more people to support me if I run a second fund raising campaign. Reaching 50% will mean that I get the top - quality Copy Editor I want. Reaching 75% will ensure the printing of the hardback edition. Whatever percentage I reach, I will work out a separate plan to achieve the rest of the goals. 

Other ways you can help? 

I plan to create some amazing events and experiences using the community I manage to create through this book. You can help me by spreading the word to your friends and also by leading the efforts in your region.

As a writer and filmmaker, I have learned the need for visiting a place, living there myself at least for a short while, understanding the people and their culture; before presenting a story set in any place in the world.My first draft is ready and therefore, I decided to connect to the global community using Indiegogo.com, partly to raise funds and partly to get feedback from the world. I believe that this book could lead to the biggest success of my life so far. I have been a non-conformist, always following my dreams. My passion to make things happen in my life, has almost always paid dividends.I need your
support to be able to give the best possible finish to Ernesto. And it is important for me that I give the book what it deserves.
To achieve
this, i. I need to go to Africa for 2 – 3 weeks to complete my research efforts
for the book. I believe that this trip will help me add more colour and depth
to my characters and thereby give a richer experience to all the readers.
ii. To pay a
top – class professional copy editor who could give it the world – class finish
I want to give to the book.
iii. To
print a limited hardback edition of the book, one of which could be yours. 
iv. To
promote and publicize Ernesto.The USD 40, 000 I am trying to raise through this platform will go into taking care of the four things above.
How can
you be involved?
I am, of course, hoping that you will make a
contribution to fund the project. I think I have worked out a set of very interesting rewards or perks. In addition to the rewards, I am trying to create an unbelievable
and amazing experience for the global community that I intend to create through
the numerous web – based and offline activities that are planned from June 5,
the launch date of the book. Wherever in the world you are,
you could be leading the effort in your region. I am sure you will enjoy this process of co - creation. Unlike most projects, you will feel a great sense of ownership by joining my efforts. Ernesto is about the power of
the human spirit, about Africa, about saving our planet and about football. I
intend to create a marvellous journey for everyone who is willing to go on this
ride with me. Your support will be the key to unlock this adventure.If I don't reach my goal?Reaching one - sixth will enable me to go to Africa. I am confident that the manner in which I will share my experience when I return, will inspire more people to support me if I run a second fund raising campaign. Reaching 50% will mean that I get the top - quality Copy Editor I want. Reaching 75% will ensure the printing of the hardback edition. Whatever percentage I reach, I will work out a separate plan to achieve the rest of the goals. Other ways you can help? I plan to create some amazing events and experiences using the community I manage to create through this book. You can help me by spreading the word to your friends and also by leading the efforts in your region.

story:
Short Summary


  • We offer products and services for large or small organizations. Our training system ensures that the group is prepared for emergencies that can happen. 

  • Mission Medical Bags provide a ready-made emergency kit for up to 25 people. This kit includes a manual that has general information on treating common illnesses and emergencies. This kit has first aid supplies and some general over the counter medications. Specialized supplies that may be necessary if seeking help from a clinic or healthcare facility. Many clinics and facilities in other countries do not have sterile supplies. We also provide First-Aid and CPR certification classes for individuals and groups. We have a variety of training packages to meet your needs.

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • This is a business start up campaign, while this is a for profit company, we work with non-profits. All contributions go toward starting this business. Paying for inventory, supplies, shipping, and training expenses. We need $25,000 to get off the ground. We have contacted several large organizations that are very interested in purchasing our product and services.
  • We are EXCITED to tell you about some of our perks for donors.
  • If our goal is not reached, the funds that are raised will go towar.ds purchasing inventory.

The Impact

  • Your contribution will help us prepare the leadership of these organizatons to handle many emergncies that could happen.  A large percentage of participants traveling are under the age of 18. Your contribution will help protect those young people traveling for many reasons; for example, Rebiulding housing for children in haiti, job training for homeless in India, treating complex healthcare issues in Africa. 
  • Our healthcare experts have traveled all over the world leading as well participating in group projects. 

Risks & Challenges

One of our main challenges is that there is no other company doing what we have set out to accomplish. But at the same that is also our advantage. We will be the architect of this type of company. 

  • We will overcome these challenges with experience, persistance, and the ability to build team of like minded individuals.
  • Mentorship from successful business leaders in our community.
  • We intend on creating a positive and  productive work environment for our team.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell people about our website   MissionMedicalBags.com 
  • If  you are not able to contibute monetarily. You can get the word out, talk about the business, tell your friends, family, post on social media. Contact any organizations you are associated with that plan group trips. Tell them about the life saving procucts and services that we offer.
  • As a reminder use the Indiegogo share tool to get the word out!

story:
Howdy! We are Kayla and Kaylee, two best friends and lovers of the open road. We are preparing a new road trip, our third together and largest yet. During this trip we want to include our friends, family, and anyone who wants to share in our experiences.  So we’ve created a campaign centered around the creation of “postcards.” Each postcard will include a story or poem inspired by experiences on our trip.  We will mail them to you from the road and then each one will be considered as a work to be featured in our final collection. Your donation will help us transform our collection of writings and photos into a unique catalog of our American adventure.

Over the course of our last two road trips, we documented our adventures through Instagram, sent the cliché postcard back home, and journaled independently. Our new catalog project will merge all three of these activities into one and create a chronicle that we can share with not only our friends and family, but with anyone seeking inspiration from travel, nature and more.

On our previous adventures we explored the American Southwest and the U.S. West Coast. We are now setting out on a five-week journey across the U.S. East Coast. We have estimated that the trip will cost over $2,500 (gas, food, lodging and other expenses).

Help us turn this undertaking, and our “Postcard Prose” idea, into a reality by making a donation. Your donation will offset some of the cost of this trip, and allow us to save some of our funds for our future endeavors. 

We want to share this experience with you and we know you'll enjoy looking at, reading, and listening to the fun ways we come up with to make you a part of this adventure.

Please join us!

Destinations:

  • Ozarks National Park, Missouri
  • Chicago, Illinois
  • Cuyahoga Valley National Park, Ohio
  • Niagara Falls, New York
  • Toronto, Canada
  • Montreal, Canada
  • Acadia National Park, Maine
  • New Haven, Connecticut
  • Providence, Rhode Island
  • Portsmouth, New Hampshire
  • Boston, Massachusetts
  • New York City, New York
  • Philadelphia, Pennsylvania
  • Shenandoah National Park, Virginia
  • Raleigh, North Carolina
  • Wilmington, North Carolina
  • Asheville, North Carolina
  • Great Smoky Mountains National Park, Tennessee
  • Knoxville, Tennessee
  • Nashville, Tennessee
  • Hot Springs National Park, Arkansas

story:
Short Summary

I am Theresa Derwin, supporting Willie Meikle and Mark Hogg (Mr.Markzilla) to get a brand new book off the ground featuring stories about Myths & Monsters with accompanying illustrations. Mark is a talented artist who suffers from two prolapsed discs and nerve damage through a work accident reliant on benefits since 1994. However, as well as funding the book you will be funding Mark to become a self employed artist, providing necessary equipment and software to enable him to become independent. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for £7,000 to create this exciting book of art by Mark Hogg (Mr. Markzilla) and short stories by Willie Meikle. There will be between ten & twelve short stories with each story having an accompanying illustration. Both Willie and Mark will receive a fee for their time (each drawing takes between eight to ten days). To enable Mark to become independently self employed, we need to purchase him an A3 Scanner and SLR camera with lenses and filters. This sum will also cover:

  • Limited print run signed hardback of Myths & Monsters
  • The print cost of the book
  • A variety of prints from the book for backers, A5, A4 and A3 drawings,
  • One backer's celebrity portrait commission (your choice) in A3,
  • One backer's pencil portrait from family a photo (A3)
  • Trade Paperback edition of Myths & Monsters
  • Your name in one of five stories published.
  • Production, printing, postage & signing of the books is included
  • A number of dealer's tables at significant conventions (Heresy & Heelz Burlesque Fare, Memorabilia, Sci-Fi Weekender, Andromeda Two) and other events so that Mark can start to sell his art work and prints (the cost of which will be included in this campaign).
  • An ebook will also be available.

We will still be able to produce this book and prints if we don’t reach our full goal; the funds will ensure the writer and artist get their fees, and Mark gets his equipment to become self employed with the scanner at the very least.

The Impact

This project will enable Mark Hogg (MrMarkzillaArtist) http://markhogg11.wix.com/mr-markzilla-artist to become self employed and independent. His 'Lemmy' from Motorhead portrait had over 150,000 hits and he has been approached by Michael Berryman of The Hills Have Eyes and Lysette Anthony of Krull for a personal portrait. David Hasslehoff, Caroline Munro and Samantha Fox all own artwork by Mark. It will also ensure both Willie Meikle http://www.williammeikle.com/ and Mark receive a professional rate of pay for their work as well as a higher profile in a competitive industry. It will also provide backers with beautiful photorealistic pencil art work, books and a potentially valuable re-saleable product from the incredible selection of perks on offer. Theresa Derwin, who is editing the project has edited six books in the last eighteen months for Fringeworks Ltd and KnightWatch Press, and has had over seventeen stories published in various anthologies as well as her own collection of short stories Monsters Anonymous, published by Anarchy Books. Willie Meikle is a prolific and fantastic genre writer with over 200 stories published to his name, including the successful Abominable novella and a number of Challenger works published by Dark Regions Press.

Other Ways You Can Help

How can you help?

  • Get the word out there
  • Obviously we would love your backing
  • Follow and Tweet @BarbarellaFem, @williemeikle and @MrMarkzilla
  • Find out more at www.terror-tree.co.uk
  • www.theresa-derwin.co.uk
  • http://www.williammeikle.com/
  • http://markhogg11.wix.com/mr-markzilla-artist
  • Search for MrMarkzilla Artist on Facebook

story:
A book proposal writing project

Is there a Ghost in the Machine? 
Toyota's runaway cars have been a topic of fierce debate for a decade. No one from Toyota will admit to any electronics defects that cause cars to run out of control. But Toyota inadvertently gave away the truth to a woman who wouldn't keep quiet about it.
SOMETHING IS WRONG with the CAR ELECTRONICS. Benjaminson says that Toyota's internal documents show that the company's engineers saw what they could not explain, and called it "ghosts."
An unpredictable car can kill, and sometimes it does.
...
How did Betsy turn whistleblower? As a Japanese-to-English translator, she was hired by Toyota's legal team to translate documents that the Dept. of Justice later used to investigate Toyota's criminal acts. Just like the DOJ, BETSY SMELT A RAT. There were just too many weird things that she could not ignore. After checking in with top experts, she felt compelled to come forward, and when the government would not act to protect consumers, she became an obsessive leaker of documents to help alert people to the ongoing risk. 
*       *       *
Learn how one woman tenaciously waged a series of battles against a secretive global giant, what happened, and how the story is not over...nor will it ever be.
******************************************************************

  • How I will spend the money

Transcriptions, research, hired expert proposal writing, and packaging the proposal. $2500 will cover the cost of a basic working proposal. The more money raised, the more elaborate and compelling a proposal can be produced, leading to a bigger and better book.

  • Why this book is important

Toyota's car defects were investigated by the U.S. government and by big media. Everyone knows about them, and many think drivers are at fault and the story is over. But there is an ongoing cover-up. I want to reveal the whole truth and the danger to the public. My story is a thriller with behind-the-scenes page-turning action, but it links to a bigger story of automaker greed, media cooperation, and government complicity. Ultimately, consumers will be empowered by knowing this story.

  • Stretch goals

When we go past $2500, the next steps can be funded too. These will include deciding on the publication route, formalizing publication plans, research, interviews, writing, editing, and possibly book design and publication itself. As we reach and pass the initial goal and future milestone goals, we'll update you with the precise project plan and upcoming expenses.

story:
COUCH TO COUCH: Transforming Travels on the French Huguenot Trail

What is Couch to Couch:

Couch to Couch: My Transforming Travels on the French Huguenot Trail  is the  title of the book I'm writing  describing my adventurous 17 country and 5 continent global journey tracing  some amazing pioneers. Who are these amazing men and women? They're the French Protestants, or Huguenots, who risked death to leave France four hundred years ago.

What do I need:

This appeal is the first stage of my book campaign. The immediate goal of $10,000 is to support my continuing work on Couch to Couch and relocation from California  to my writing community in Geneva where I'll  complete the book. 
Transportation plus short-term housing costs: $8, 365
Consulting costs: $868
 Professsional Development:  $767

 I also need response from others' sympathetic to the book's many diverse themes in order to give the book a platform and show me new directions for the book.

The Results:

This first stage will make it possible for me to:

1. Speed the book's completion

2.  Enable me to renew and keep my French Visitor visa given for this project 

3. Place me again in contact with members of the Geneva Writers Group providing support for completion of my book.

Rhea's Info
Looking back, although I grew up in a small rural community, my love of travel was present very early. As a child I was drawn to the glow of lamps at night in dining cars of trains headed north to New York City - I wanted to jump on board and follow those lights.

To date I've published two books:

 Upper Beacon Hill,  Arcadia Publishing, Charleston, SC, 2002

Boston's French Secrets: Guided Walks That Reveal Boston's French Heritage, Images From the Past, Bennington VT, 2004. 

Boston's French Secrets was a WInner of ForeWord Magazine's 2004 Best Travel Guide Book of the Year  Award.

 In addition to a B.A. from Beaver College now Arcadia University,  I also have a M.Ed in Counseling Psychology from Boston University. Writers of all poeple need help ferreting out the quirks and twists of their characters and of course of themselves.

It's an asset I believe that to some I'm not well qualified to write this book, nay sayers can be helpful. What I do have is a passion to find hidden truths, the ability to overcome all limits, to become unstoppable, to take risks to reach the next goal, to find support in meditation and to laugh at myself and life. And most important I love what I do and I never, never give up.

What We Need & What You Get


We need your support and enthusiasm to bring these early International Pioneers to Print.

To show our gratitude here are some of the  perks or gifts we'll be giving you in recognition of your donations

SOME OF OUR UNIQUE PERKS:

$10 - We'll send you a Twitter Thank You - your own tweet of thanks

$20 - A Thank You Postcard -A Personal thank you Postcard of Thanks emailed

$35 - Your Name on the Book's Supporter Page. Your name will be featured as a loyal Couch to Couch supporter.

$50 - SUPER SUPPORTER BUNDLE - All of above, yes we mean i


$100 -Private Tour of Calvin's Paris with Rhea, including  French bistro lunch near site of Calvin's daring escape from Paris.

$600 -A weekend for two at Historic Huguenot Street, site above New York City where Huguenots settled in the late 17th century. One of the earliest stone houses is in photo above one. Stay at Dutch style inn with fabulous satisfying food and tour the grounds with your own Guide. You might find a missing ancestor!!

$1,500 -  Role in movie many predict will be filmed of Couch to Couch. Own transport, however lodging, food provided during filming.

The Impact

      My wish to bring the Huguenots story to print, is not just a wish, it's a mission that has fired my energies every day for the past eight years. Can you imagine leaving your country as the Huguenots did, your language, your parents and friends, your home, your work even your children to carry your religion and your way of life to strange countries around the world? To be called a "heretic," to be called "victim", to be treated as "different" almost everywhere you went? To face death if you were caught crossing the French borders, to face life in prison or in irons if you were apprehended holding secret worship services in the forests at night? I'm not sure of my answers, are you? They leave us untold contributions I'll share - universities, patented inventions, works of art, textiles - the list is endless.

     One new fact alone sends me  out each day:  Over half of the Presidents of the United States are direct descendants of these French who chose to leave France. Starting with George Washington they govern with the conviction of their ancestors. 

     Essentially the Huguenots' story is a hidden segment of history - European history, Amerian history and South American history - that demands to be heard. It has the potential of rewrting history as we know it. That is why we count on you to be part of this project bringing light to a people too long hidden and unknown.

Risks & Challenges

     The main risk the project faces is my giving up and not completing Couch to Couch.These past months in California I've taken care of some serious medical problems with help from others. During my research I put my body's needs aside and now I'm taking time to correct them.
 Correct and move on to Geneva. It's the "move on" mind set I have that overcomes any obstacle. It constantly amazes those close to me. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends, your family, your distant family, your co-workers, even your boss  and your lovers about the Couch to Couch campaign. Get the word out please. And do  send me your ideas for possible improvements and any interesting facts about passionate travel. The Indiegogo share tools are there to help. 

Don't let money or the lack of it  stand in your way. You are an important source of spreading the word. Thanks to each person  who dares to reach out and take a risk by taking action.

3. Place me again in contact with members of the Geneva Writers Group providing support for completion of my book.

Rhea's Info

Looking back, although I grew up in a small rural community, my love of travel was present very early. As a child I was drawn to the glow of lamps at night in dining cars of trains headed north to New York City - I wanted to jump on board and follow those lights.
To date I've published two books:
 Upper Beacon Hill,  Arcadia Publishing, Charleston, SC, 2002
Boston's French Secrets: Guided Walks That Reveal Boston's French Heritage, Images From the Past, Bennington VT, 2004. 
Boston's French Secrets was a WInner of ForeWord Magazine's 2004 Best Travel Guide Book of the Year  Award.
 In addition to a B.A. from Beaver College now Arcadia University,  I also have a M.Ed in Counseling Psychology from Boston University. Writers of all poeple need help ferreting out the quirks and twists of their characters and of course of themselves.
It's an asset I believe that to some I'm not well qualified to write this book, nay sayers can be helpful. What I do have is a passion to find hidden truths, the ability to overcome all limits, to become unstoppable, to take risks to reach the next goal, to find support in meditation and to laugh at myself and life. And most important I love what I do and I never, never give up.
What We Need & What You Get
 

We need your support and enthusiasm to bring these early International Pioneers to Print.
To show our gratitude here are some of the  perks or gifts we'll be giving you in recognition of your donations
SOME OF OUR UNIQUE PERKS:

$10 - We'll send you a Twitter Thank You - your own tweet of thanks

$20 - A Thank You Postcard -A Personal thank you Postcard of Thanks emailed

$35 - Your Name on the Book's Supporter Page. Your name will be featured as a loyal Couch to Couch supporter.

$50 - SUPER SUPPORTER BUNDLE - All of above, yes we mean i





$100 -Private Tour of Calvin's Paris with Rhea, including  French bistro lunch near site of Calvin's daring escape from Paris.



$600 -A weekend for two at Historic Huguenot Street, site above New York City where Huguenots settled in the late 17th century. One of the earliest stone houses is in photo above one. Stay at Dutch style inn with fabulous satisfying food and tour the grounds with your own Guide. You might find a missing ancestor!!


$1,500 -  Role in movie many predict will be filmed of Couch to Couch. Own transport, however lodging, food provided during filming.

  The Impact       My wish to bring the Huguenots story to print, is not just a wish, it's a mission that has fired my energies every day for the past eight years. Can you imagine leaving your country as the Huguenots did, your language, your parents and friends, your home, your work even your children to carry your religion and your way of life to strange countries around the world? To be called a "heretic," to be called "victim", to be treated as "different" almost everywhere you went? To face death if you were caught crossing the French borders, to face life in prison or in irons if you were apprehended holding secret worship services in the forests at night? I'm not sure of my answers, are you? They leave us untold contributions I'll share - universities, patented inventions, works of art, textiles - the list is endless.
     One new fact alone sends me  out each day:  Over half of the Presidents of the United States are direct descendants of these French who chose to leave France. Starting with George Washington they govern with the conviction of their ancestors. 
     Essentially the Huguenots' story is a hidden segment of history - European history, Amerian history and South American history - that demands to be heard. It has the potential of rewrting history as we know it. That is why we count on you to be part of this project bringing light to a people too long hidden and unknown.
  Risks & Challenges

     The main risk the project faces is my giving up and not completing Couch to Couch.These past months in California I've taken care of some serious medical problems with help from others. During my research I put my body's needs aside and now I'm taking time to correct them.
 Correct and move on to Geneva. It's the "move on" mind set I have that overcomes any obstacle. It constantly amazes those close to me. 
Other Ways You Can Help
 Tell your friends, your family, your distant family, your co-workers, even your boss  and your lovers about the Couch to Couch campaign. Get the word out please. And do  send me your ideas for possible improvements and any interesting facts about passionate travel. The Indiegogo share tools are there to help. 
Don't let money or the lack of it  stand in your way. You are an important source of spreading the word. Thanks to each person  who dares to reach out and take a risk by taking action.

story:
I am Born Before (né Benny Biesek), an emerging poet whom you've probably never heard of. I was a featured reader several times, placed poems with journals, etc. 20+ times, and self-published thee chapbooks of poetry, in 2013, as well as served as a co-organizer for poetry readings locally. I have begun to find my own voice as a poet, influenced in part by poems written by E.E. Cummings, Jack Kerouac and Carl Sandburg. 2014 could be a year of continued-development for my poetry. 

One Year More Poems means self-publishing 52 electronic chapbooks of my own poetry in 2014 (a chapbook is a short book). Each chapbook would have 8 or 9 poems in it; your funding would cover my cost-of-living expenses for the year plus costs associated with producing this project and this project alone. (I will not spend money pledged here on other projects.)

This is a highly personal project. Each chapbook will sell for $1.00; my goal is to allow access at a low cost. I am not sure just how to give back specifically, but if this project is funded I will be able to pursue hosting as many as 104 poetry readings in 2014 in SLO County.

I hope to inspire other poets to go as I am now going. $18,720 in funding is my goal but I pledge to produce one chapbook for every $360.00 pledged to me here. (Be sure to check out the perks. Feel free to ask me questions about this project.)

I write poems that speak for me but I also speak on behalf of my poems. A year of poetry is a chance for me to develop that voice; I plan to help other poets find their own voice in 2014 and beyond in whatever ways I can. My sense is that this project will allow me to more fully speak and speak for other poets ... Please be sure to use the share tools here at Indiegogo and thank you for your donations.

story:
With over 24 million sufferers in the USA alone, there are many of you that will have had first hand experience of an eating disorder, or have a loved one affected. Lovers, Mothers, Fathers, Spouses, siblings and friends are all affected when an individual suffers with an eating disorder.

Anorexia Speaks is a book I have written on the subject and will be the first of many. I welcome your stories and you questions and hope that you can find some answers in the stories of others.

Anorexia Speaks


‘The actions and events accounted for in this book amazed and disturbed me as I wrote them. My own activities on a daily basis so much greater than the human body should be able to stand. A devastating achievement’- Excerpt from Prologue Anorexia Speaks.


Anorexia Speaks describes a 24 hour period in the day and the mind of a 22 year old woman suffering a severe eating disorder. Her activities and thoughts are depicted in two perspectives. The first is that of her rational mind as she struggles to remain in her perceived position of control. The second is the voice of her eating disorder that has been a strong and destructive influence on her life for 5 years already.


This memoir is a stark portrayal of the devastation that an eating disorder can have on not only the sufferer, but the parents, friends and family involved. Contradictory thoughts and actions show the reader the psychology behind the visual representation of Anorexia Nervosa and the complex nature of the illness. Tabitha was inspired to write Anorexia Speaks after a number of emails and messages of support that she received since she started blogging about her journey and experience with Anorexia Nervosa.


Anorexia Speaks will help sufferers to reach an understanding of the distinction between their own mind and body and the conflicting thoughts that they may experience. It is a book to aid understanding of a disorder that is growing at a rapid rate in our society. With 80% of 10 year olds reported to have concerns about their weight this is a subject area that affects a staggering amount of people. Anorexia Speaks can help demystify this complex disorder.


Anorexia Speaks is completed and is currently being professionally edited. This book will be the first in a line of books that Tabitha intends to write  addressing the nature of eating disorders. Tabitha has drafted and is currently working her second book- Anorexia Decoded that takes the actions, thoughts and words that Tabitha habitually used when she was a sufferer and ties those in with the current science around eating disorders, binge eating and over- eating. 

Sections covered include, emotional eating, habits and habit breaking, food psychology and nutritional evidence as to what the body needs.


Your contribution will help me continue to get the second book edited and published.

story:
We are the Political Action Committee that sponsors and supports the Marijuana Legalization Petition Initiatives in Arizona.

We need the funds to print the petition forms for the 2016 Marijuana Legalization Initiative.

We have a proposed initiative text draft that can be seen at: 

http://www.super-tech.com/2016_Draft_XXXI_Amendment.pdf

We need contributions of less than $50.00 per person.  With contributions of more than $50.00 we need personal contact information to be in compliance with campaign law funding requirements.

You can preserve your anonymity and help Marijuana become legalized in Arizona.  Current law makes any amount a felony charge which makes users a sub-class citizen. 

We need your help to get the funding to have the petitions printed for the 2016 campaign.

What side of history do you want to be on?

story:
Video= vague on purpose. I am not Jenna Marbles and I don't "vlog", but maybe I should start because its appallingly clear how little anyone reads these days. Attention spans are only growing smaller and seem only capable of committing themselves to trivial matters, like the latest scoop on Kim and Kanye. For now,  I am a writer and I want you to read.  There is much more depth to the purpose of this campaign than what my elated essence may convey... Though I may not take myself very seriously, I take life and all of my ambitious endeavors very sincerely. If this doesn't say it, I don't know what does:



Only two people were chosen for the Chinese International Exchange Program, and I am lucky enough to be one of them! My name is Moe (Monique) and my latest, greatest adventure(s) is fast approaching…Come the 4th of March, I will be planted in the scholarly city of Shenyang to spend the following five months learning Chinese and living the dream! My mind soars through the infinite adventures to come. My weekdays will be spent diligently attending my required studies, but the weekends on the other hand are essentially all mine!

Work hard, play harder, right?

 

My definition of playing consists of exploring of EVERY corner this new foreign wonderland has to offer! I anticipate China has MANY corners; even with five months to work with, I doubt I can shed light on ALL of them, but that is a challenge I more than willing to embrace never the less! With the help of generous hearts, the possibilities are endless!

 

You see, though I just earned my associates degree free of any crippling debt or the burden of heaping loans to pay, I personally can cover the expenses required by the exchange program taking me there. Those expenses cover airfare and all of the miscellaneous fees in between (Visa, health insurance, Etc.) , but I lack personal funding to make all of the epic expeditions my heart and soul ache for… 

This will not be my first expedition out of the country. After spending an INCREDIBLE month and a small fortune in Costa Rica (pictures below), I learned that experiences are priceless.

  However, making these irreplaceable experiences happen is certainly expensive, BUT TOTALLY WORTH IT! I am so grateful for this opportunity to live and study in Shenyang, but this is CHINA we are talking about and there is so much more to see, to feel, to smell, to taste, to EXPERIENCE. I believe the meaning of life is TO LIVE IT and I am doing just THAT at maximum capacity. 

It would be just plain rude to keep all of this excitement to myself which is why I am inviting you to join me by helping me get these places! There is beauty in this opportunity and it is not just one sided, for this is also an opportunity for everyone who can’t make this physical journey as well.  This is an opportunity for you to live vicariously through well, none other than yours truly. For every dollar you donate to my cause, you are helping me go that much further and I truly cherish that. You may be thinking, “How does giving Moe money allow ME to live vicariously?” or “How do I know my hard earned dollars are actually helping Monique explore and see the best of China?” Good questions inquisitive reader. Lucky for y’all, I am majoring in photojournalism and I plan on documenting my fulfilling journey(s) EVERY STEP OF THE WAY. That means keeping a detailed travel journal (blog) and taking LOTS and LOTS of pictures and maybe even a few videos here and there.  Exploring, photographing, and writing about it all combine my three FAVORITE passions, which is why I am pursuing an exciting career as a photojournalist in the first place!

As a curious being with an insatiable appetite for adventure and excitement, I tend to get myself in some very peculiar places and situations to say the least. I am young, dumb, and fearless. Those who know me claim that this is one of the most unique and outstanding aspects of my fun loving free spirit.  This frequent occurring phenomena makes for many interesting recaps, and they have been collectively coined (because of my name (Moe) + the "WTF" moments I experience on a regular basis + my fondness of puns) as “MOE-Ments" ; these unique, amusing experiences are like wine, and seem to only get better as I age and ferment in serendipity.  Saving animals from brutal fates, getting unfathomably lost, snapping prolific pictures, and getting silly with strangers (or just myself) is really just the tip of the iceberg that is my life. I encourage you to see for yourself.

 

My end goal is to publish these rich experiences to come, and call it “Epic MOE-Ments In China!” (E.M.I.C)  and that way I can share my travels and personal/philosophical/visual (since I can't PHYSICALLY take you with me) journey through the magnificent land of CHINA with the rest of the world! Whether it will be a physical book or a e-book series with interactive videos and such, is yet to be decided (hopefully both, even though people hardly read these days. PS Thank you for actually reading THIS). I want E.M.I.C. to serve as an inspiration to everyone to follow their dreams, and also get out and see this vast planet we are so fortunate to live on. It's not fair that this intrinsically worthless green cloth paper we call "money" (or lack thereof) could hold so much influence on how we live/ limit our lives. I choose not to let it limit mine! Just because I am broke, does not mean my dreams have to be too! Please help me quench my wanderlust and fund the flow of “MOE-ments” to come while you join me on my journey through the world’s oldest surviving dynasty! 

I can’t do it without you! Actually, I can do it and I am doing it. It feels good to get this far on my, but additional funding will get me a lot further! "Nobody can do everything, but everybody can do something." Sometimes there is more to life than fancy cars, and nice watches. It feels good to be kind, give it a try!

story:
About Me

Hi. I'm Mike Spinak. I've been writing since I was young, and making pictures since 1998. Lifelong passions for nature, travel, and creative expression have developed into a lifestyle and career in writing and photography. 

Two years ago, I asked the online community for help funding the publication of my first book, Growing Up Humming. It got funded, got published, and soon became the #1 Top-Rated book out of nearly 50,000 in its category on Amazon - and stayed #1 for six months straight. 

About the Book

Now I'm asking for your help funding the publication of a larger, more ambitious book, The Onshore Lives of Northern Elephant Seals.

Elephant seals have one of the strangest lifestyles in the animal kingdom. People would be amazed by the details, but most folks know little or nothing about them. I want to bring their story to you, through my own words and photos.

The Onshore Lives of Northern Elephant Seals is filled with detailed observations of their behaviors, all clearly shown in photos, and explained with simple but deep explanations. 

Why It Matters

Northern elephant seals were hunted heavily, until they were believed to have been driven extinct. It's harder to appreciate the lives of creatures we know little about. The better we understand nature, the more it matters to us, and the better we are at taking care of it. One can't help but respect these remarkable beasts, upon learning the extremes their survival entails. Furthermore, the better we understand biology and ecology, the better we are at making the smartest decisions about managing our world.

The Onshore Lives of Northern Elephant Seals can help inform people both about these majestic creatures, and about how biology works.

Where the Money Goes

The book is already written and photographed. Now I just need to fund the costs of turning the text and pictures into a published book. Your prepayments will go toward editing, proofreading, graphic design, cover design, book design, purchasing ISBN codes, formatting for various eBook formats, and all of the other costs of publishing a book. With your help, I can get it published within just a few months.

What You Get

You can get an eBook of The Onshore Lives of Northern Elephant Seals; your name listed in the book as a backer; an eBook of my previous book, Growing Up Humming; an eBook of my next book, when it is ready; a high resolution digital photo file of a nice elephant seal picture, suitable for printing large; and 3 hours of wildlife photography instruction, through one-on-one video conferencing, where we can discuss vision, technique, gear, animal tracking, or whatever you prefer.

Raves

Here's some of early buzz for The Onshore Lives of Northern Elephant Seals:

"Mike Spinak's book is a fascinating exploration of elephant seals' lives on dry land. Its clear and thorough study of their physiology and habits is accompanied by photographs of their environments, details of their bodies, and moments of their social interaction. The difficult-to-capture images are both beautiful and intense."

"The book pulls no punches and presents an entire range of behavior, from tender to fierce, and the lengths that these massive animals must go to in order to survive and flourish. I enjoyed this in-depth view into their lives, and have emerged with a deeper understanding and a fresh appreciation of these extraordinary animals. VERY impressive work!" - Helen Sotiriadis

"This is great. The matter-of-fact presentation of the tough stuff is excellent. Another fantastic creature I know much better through Mike Spinak's amazing new book." - Ed Sweeney

"Mike Spinak has done a masterful job of researching northern elephant seals and illustrating the manuscript with images that tell a story. The diversity of the various seals and behaviors he photographed is excellent." - Richard Wong


"The Onshore Lives of Northern Elephant seals is a fascinating look at an extremely remarkable, but little known sea mammal. Mike Spinak has photographed every phase of their shore life in intimate detail, capturing a full range of their behaviors in images that are both informative and visually stunning. Spinak's clearly written text is a fine complement to the photographs, both in discussing behaviors and in describing the adaptations that support their unusual life cycle. Elephant seals were almost extinct, but made a strong comeback. This book is a fine way to learn more about these unique animals."  - Bill Tyler


" 'Onshore Lives' is one of those surprising books that is impossible to put down. Not because you want to find out 'who done it,' but because it reveals fascinating details about incredible creatures most of us will only ever see at a distance. Mr. Spinak's photography is intimate and stunning; his narrative is easily understood and engaging. He avoids sugar-coating or anthropomorphizing the elephant seals, but presents their life story in a fact-rich, sympathetic manner. I wholeheartedly recommend 'Onshore Lives' to anyone with an ounce of curiosity about animal life and to everyone who enjoys beautiful photography." - Terrie Gray
