The Onshore Lives of Northern Elephant Seals is filled with detailed observations of their behaviors, all clearly shown in photos, and explained with simple but deep explanations. 
Why It Matters
Northern elephant seals were hunted heavily, until they were believed to have been driven extinct. It's harder to appreciate the lives of creatures we know little about. The better we understand nature, the more it matters to us, and the better we are at taking care of it. One can't help but respect these remarkable beasts, upon learning the extremes their survival entails. Furthermore, the better we understand biology and ecology, the better we are at making the smartest decisions about managing our world.
The Onshore Lives of Northern Elephant Seals can help inform people both about these majestic creatures, and about how biology works.
Where the Money Goes
The book is already written and photographed. Now I just need to fund the costs of turning the text and pictures into a published book. Your prepayments will go toward editing, proofreading, graphic design, cover design, book design, purchasing ISBN codes, formatting for various eBook formats, and all of the other costs of publishing a book. With your help, I can get it published within just a few months.
What You Get

You can get an eBook of The Onshore Lives of Northern Elephant Seals; your name listed in the book as a backer; an eBook of my previous book, Growing Up Humming; an eBook of my next book, when it is ready; a high resolution digital photo file of a nice elephant seal picture, suitable for printing large; and 3 hours of wildlife photography instruction, through one-on-one video conferencing, where we can discuss vision, technique, gear, animal tracking, or whatever you prefer.

Raves

Here's some of early buzz for The Onshore Lives of Northern Elephant Seals:


"Mike Spinak's book is a fascinating exploration of elephant seals' lives on dry land. Its clear and thorough study of their physiology and habits is accompanied by photographs of their environments, details of their bodies, and moments of their social interaction. The difficult-to-capture images are both beautiful and intense."

"The book pulls no punches and presents an entire range of behavior, from tender to fierce, and the lengths that these massive animals must go to in order to survive and flourish. I enjoyed this in-depth view into their lives, and have emerged with a deeper understanding and a fresh appreciation of these extraordinary animals. VERY impressive work!" - Helen Sotiriadis

"This is great. The matter-of-fact presentation of the tough stuff is excellent. Another fantastic creature I know much better through Mike Spinak's amazing new book." - Ed Sweeney

"Mike Spinak has done a masterful job of researching northern elephant seals and illustrating the manuscript with images that tell a story. The diversity of the various seals and behaviors he photographed is excellent." - Richard Wong

"The Onshore Lives of Northern Elephant seals is a fascinating look at an extremely remarkable, but little known sea mammal. Mike Spinak has photographed every phase of their shore life in intimate detail, capturing a full range of their behaviors in images that are both informative and visually stunning. Spinak's clearly written text is a fine complement to the photographs, both in discussing behaviors and in describing the adaptations that support their unusual life cycle. Elephant seals were almost extinct, but made a strong comeback. This book is a fine way to learn more about these unique animals."  - Bill Tyler

" 'Onshore Lives' is one of those surprising books that is impossible to put down. Not because you want to find out 'who done it,' but because it reveals fascinating details about incredible creatures most of us will only ever see at a distance. Mr. Spinak's photography is intimate and stunning; his narrative is easily understood and engaging. He avoids sugar-coating or anthropomorphizing the elephant seals, but presents their life story in a fact-rich, sympathetic manner. I wholeheartedly recommend 'Onshore Lives' to anyone with an ounce of curiosity about animal life and to everyone who enjoys beautiful photography." - Terrie Gray

story:
Llevamos más de un año consultando a distintos especialistas, entrando y saliendo de diferentes hospitales, tanto públicos como privados, y seguimos sin ver ninguna mejoría y su salud sigue deteriorándose. Hemos gastado en cuentas hospitalarias, análisis y estudios más de 40,000 USD. Gastando todos nuestros ahorros en la busqueda de una cura. Lamentablemente mi papá no cuenta con seguro de gastos médicos.

En un principio, al comienzo de sus malestares, pensábamos que se había complicado su enfisema pulmonar, el cual ya padecía de tiempo atrás, pero un neumólogo, concluyó que estaba estable en ese aspecto.

En noviembre de 2013 (hace un año) fue hospitalizado en el Hospital Lomas de San Luis por cansancio excesivo y rápida baja de peso sin razón aparente. El médico tratante le diagnosticó insuficiencia cardiaca y anemia, por lo que lo refirió con un Dr. Hematólogo, el cual le realizó múltiples transfusiones de sangre, dos aspirados de médula y una biopsia de médula, sin presentarse anomalías en los resultados.

Por un tiempo siguió presentando los mismos síntomas y agravándose cada vez más, hasta que, a mediados de este año, se le hospitalizó por sugerencia del Dr. Hematólogo. Diagnosticándole nuevamente anemia y dándolo de alta al día siguiente.

Al continuar su malestar, los doctores decidieron internarlo en el Hospital Central para que varios doctores analizaran su caso. Después de muchos días y múltiples estudios, seguían sin encontrar la causa de su enfermedad.

Paralelamente, falleció de manera repentina el perro que teníamos en casa, presentando síntomas similares a los de mi papá (debilidad y anemia). Por esta razón, preguntamos al veterinario que lo trató y sugirió hacerle un estudio a mi papá para detectar una bacteria que afecta directamente a la sangre llamada Rickettssia. La prueba la realizamos por nuestra cuenta, ya que en el hospital no aceptaron la sugerencia.

El resultado de este estudio fue positivo, observándose Rickettsia +++. Al comunicar estos estudios a dicho hospital, el Dr. Infectólogo quiso comprobarlo por su cuenta, informando que el proceso tardaría más de un mes en realizarse, y mi papá sentía que no lo soportaría, cada vez estaba más débil y cansado.

Posteriormente fue trasladado a Querétaro, en donde un infectólogo que supo del caso dijo que tenía que ser tratado de inmediato de lo contrario podia morir debido a la Ricketssiosis. Estuvo internado en el Hospital del Sagrado Corazón de Jesús, donde fue atendido por el Dr. Infectólogo, quien le aplicó tratamiento para combatir la rickettsiosis, enfermedad que causó muchos daños al organismo de mi papá, afectándole también el hígado y el bazo.

El bazo estaba secuestrándole plaquetas. Le transfundieron sangre nuevamente en grandes cantidades y la anemia persistía, por lo que decidieron extirparle el bazo. Acto seguido, le hicieron una biopsia de hígado y analizaron otros líquidos, encontrando únicamente citomegalovirus igg, cuyo tratamiento podía aplicarse en casa.

Una vez estable, fue dado de alta. Ya estando de regreso en San Luis, la hemoglobina siguió en niveles bajos, e incluso bajando, a pesar del tratamiento. Además, presentaba temperaturas muy altas y el cansancio extremo continuaba.

Nuevamente fue hospitalizado por sugerencia de los doctores, realizándole más estudios repetidos a los anteriores y más transfusiones de sangre sin encontrar anomalías.

A la fecha sigue con los mismos síntomas y sin mostrar mejoría: constante cansancio, anemia, falta de oxígeno y debilidad. A pesar de contar con suministro de oxígeno las 24 horas del día, múltiples medicamentos y una buena alimentación, seguimos sin ver buenos resultados ni avances y lo que es peor, sin tener un diagnósitico de lo que realmente tiene

story:
Short Summary

Negative Assets is a project undertaken by me, Taylor Farner, senior CSU Channel Islands English major, as  my senior capstone. Everyone who has contributed content to the magazine is a current student of CSU Channel Islands, alumni, or a member of the community. For most, this will be their first published work. I'm producing the project myself, with 9 other individuals submitting content, and a handful of experts looking over my shoulder and giving me nudges here and there. 

The goal of the project is to create an outlet for creative individuals to put their work out for others to enjoy, and get their name in print. A huge step of becoming successful in the creative world is getting used to people seeing your work and knowing who you are based on what work you're producing.

After the first issue is printed, Negative Assets will continue on in many other issues and volumes. It is my goal, and all else contributing, that the project will continue on, gaining interest of other like-minded individuals to put the work in and make future projects happen. 

What We Need & What You Get

The reason Negative Assets is in need of funding boils down to the printing cost. After searching around the community for different printers, the only one that seemed relatively feasible was going to cost an upwards of $1,100 for the smallest batch we were willing to print (100 copies) and at a smaller page count. 

A company based out of the UK, The Newspaper Club, offers printing of relatively small batches for far less cash, and prints/ships very quickly.  For the size of the magazine, the cost for printing 100 copies is going to run $655.

So far, I've managed to get a decent amount of advertising space sold to local businesses, but it isn't quite enough. There is a goal of $700 set for this project. If the goal is met, I'll be able to print 50-100 extra copies. Any extra funds will go towards printing future issues. 

The Impact

The capstone project is meant to be a culmination of what a student has learned at CSU Channel Islands, and demonstrate how they'll use their knowledge and skills to progress onward towards a career. Negative Assets is a literary magazine, and allows creative individuals to showcase their talents, dreams, and ambitions. It is an outlet for the contributors, as well as myself, to hold out the magazine and show that they made it in print, and they made the effort, and have the skills to produce something great.

By contributing to this project, you'll help make a huge step for the next generation of writers. Everyone contributing is a local artist, sharing their work with the community. Become a part of the community.

Overall, I hope to promote leisurely reading in the community. I'm tired of hearing "I hate reading." It is truly is painful. Most of the stories are genre pieces, and very entertaining, while there are a handful of editorial pieces. With future issues, hopefully the list of contributors will grow following the success of Issue #1. And hopefully this will lend future capstone courses to try something similar, and not just get their name out  there, but put it out there.

It is my sincerest hope that you're willing to contribute. On the right side of the page are two different perks. A contribution of $10 or more will earn an acknowledgement on the backside of the magazine. $15 or more will not only earn an acknowledgement, but also a copy of the magazine, shipped or hand delivered, pending how far away from Camarillo you happen to be. A contribution of $0.01 will earn my thanks and extreme gratitude for taking the time to help out and learn about my project.

Risks & Challenges

Starting this project opened up a different arena for me. I was somewhat familiar with the software needed, but immersing myself in this project has given me a lot of insight into how the technology works, and also how the business works. Contacting different printers, seeing what they offer, where to shop around. It has been a learning curve, but has also put me into an exciting industry. 

This project will be successful. Everyone that's contributed has made sure of it. They've put their hearts into it, summed up the courage to show their work to the world, and now they're looking for support. 

The financial burden isn't tremendous, but it's there. If this project interests you, please lend your support. Then, read and enjoy the magazine. Help fulfill the purpose of Negative Assets, and enjoy the work that myself and the 9 other contributors put into it. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute, there are alternatives if you're still willing to become involved. If you know someone who is interested in reading independent literature, or is an aspiring writer, turn them on to the magazine. Tell them about it, and let them know that there is an outlet for them to share their creative interests, and make their voices heard as well.

Share this page on Facebook. Email it around to people you think would be interested in a project like this. It's new, it's up and coming, and it has room to grow.

There will be a finite amount of copies. If you buy all 100 copies, but still need more, do not panic. I'll be creating an online version after printing. What format or device it will be available on is yet to be seen, but it will be here before you know it.


Thank you very much for taking time to read my story and considering contribution to a project that is built on a lot of passion, a lot of guts, and commitment. If you are interested in this project and have questions, are looking for other ways to contribute, are curious about submitting your own content for future issues, or are wanting to extend kind wishes, please contact me at taylor.farner@gmail.com. Thank you again for your time.

Taylor Farner

story:
Explorers guide to the North Country Trail: Michigan and Wisconsin 

My first book idea was pitched as a guidebook to the North Country Trail. This idea turned into my first book, 50 Hikes in Michigan's Upper Peninsula.

That original idea has been accepted and will include all of Michigan and Wisconsin. This will be the FIRST guidebook to cover the entire trail, including road walks. 

What We Need & What You Get

Writing a book isn't glamorous. It is time consuming and expensive. There are travel, lodging, and equipment costs. I'll have to buy some stock photos, countless maps, books, and other resources. I have to pay reviewers and some editors out of my own pocket as the publisher does not cover these costs. 

By supporting this project, you can receive:

  • Recognition in the book
  • Signed copies of this and/or my other book
  • A presentation at your library, school, or civic group
  • Weekend camping/hiking trip with the author
  • Backpacking trips on the North Country Trail or Isle Royale. 

    The Impact

    The North Country Trail is 4600 miles long but there isn't a comprehensive guidebook to long stretches of trail. This will be the first of its kind, where we'll fill the gaps the other three Explorer's guides (50 Hikes in Wisconsin, 50 Hikes in Michigan, 50 Hikes in Michigan's Upper Peninsula) don't cover.

story:
Hey you reading this

Thanks in advance for simply opening this project and surviving the my awkwardness in front of the camera, let me tell you some stuff about me. I live in Costa Rica, a small country in central America you probably had never heard of. I have been writing since I was 15 and now I'm ready to publish my first novel. Since I am a college student I will be self-publishing with Createspace, I want to have full control over the cover and regular publishing doesn't allow this. Big publishing houses won't even let you choose the cover you want, and as you may have seen on the pitch video and images, I have a lot of ideas for the cover and want it to be the way I like it. Since a young age I have been in love with fantasy epics such as Lord of the Rings and Narnia, also young adult fantasy like Harry Potter and even more romantic stories like The Hunger Games. This book is inspired by both genres and combines elements of both to create a Young Adult Fantasy Epic (I know, it sounds awesome.) The book is part of a two trilogy saga with narrations from the different main characters, in this case The Wielders.

What's the book about?

The story is set in the fantasy land of Eretria, to know more about the back-story of the book you can go up and see the video. 

The book follows two stories. 

The first one is about Valent, the brother of the new Wielder of Rih and bender of the air. He will assume his role as a Wielder when the current one dies. Valent always lived under the shadow of his brother, but a life changing encounter with a deadly curse will reveal his true identity as the Dragonborn, Wielder of the power of Dawl. The curse, instead of killing him, gives him visions about his future and what will happen if Dlam returns. He has to start a journey to assume his new identity and find the person who cursed him.

The second storyline is about Kella, the next Wielder of Ilma and water. After an encounter with an unknown creature known as a Malikore, she discovers the return of another dark being. A Warlock who fought for Dlam during the great war is alive and looking for Dlam's soul shards to bring him back. She travels to the frozen lands with the current Wielder, Kallin, to defeat the Warlock before he is able to summon Dlam back.

The book changes narrative between Kella and Valent, showing two different sides of the greater story about to be unveiled. While Valent discovers more about his identity as the Dragonborn, Kella tries to stop the Warlock from taking the first shard. Eventually they both meet and realize that in order to stop Dlam's return they need to find the other Wielders.


I want to give back

There are a lot of kids out there who don't have the money or means to get a book and start reading, this is why I am donating 20% of the money I'll raise with this campaign to Books for the Barrios. This is a charity that gives books to third world country kids so they may enjoy the gift of literature. As I mentioned before, I grew up in Costa Rica and even though we it is a tropical paradise for foreigners, it still is a third world country. I have seen kids living in terrible poverty and teenagers in social danger because of this, I know that this charity can help them and take them away from a bad future by showing them a world they can escape into through books.


What I need the money for:

To illustrate this better I made a pie chart, because they make stuff look smarter and simpler. 

Note: The target is $8500,  the extra $700 goes to indiegogo for hosting the campaign.

-The editing is the most expensive part because it is the hardest one, it consists on proofreading the book for grammatical errors and then copy-editing the book to help with the flow.

-The cover design is a very important part of the book since it will attract the attention of potential buyers. I want to hire a professional graphic designer to create the front and back cover along with the book spine.

-Marketing is another huge part for future sales, this way I can get the people to know the book by creating a press release, getting reviews, creating a book trailer and a big social media buzz to make the book known.

-The donation is pretty straight forward, I know that with such an amount of money the charity will make hundreds of kids happy with new books.

-This may be the most puzzling one but I do have to pay for the AWESOME perks I'm giving to you. This covers the cost of the physical perks and the international shipping.  


    The Impact

    There is no life changing impact on this project since it's a book. But there is a cultural impact to it, I was raised among books instead of TV. They provided new and different worlds to escape into. Nowadays you see kids waiting for a book's movie instead of reading it. I want to give the kids and teenagers something to enjoy with words instead of images, something that will have them sitting down for hours and make them fall in love with reading. And even though it's a Young Adult book, I believe there is no age for it, whether you are 14 and reading it because your friend told you to or 40 and reading the book for your kids, I know books are something for anyone to enjoy regardless of their age.


    How do I know the book is good and not just a 350 page piece of crap?

    This is the most important question for the backers, knowing if the book they are paying to publish is good or not. If you want to read the first six chapters of the book (They are unedited right now so it's not the final product) you can send me an email to nc.lawrence.writing@gmail.com and I will send you a PDF for you to read and make sure you like what you're paying for.


    Extra Goals

    -Any extra money will be split between donations and a more marketing and reviews.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Money isn't the only help you can give. If you're an editor or graphic designer and want to give free help I would totally welcome it.

Since a young age I have been in love with fantasy epics such as Lord of the Rings and Narnia, also young adult fantasy like Harry Potter and even more romantic stories like The Hunger Games. This book is inspired by both genres and combines elements of both to create a Young Adult Fantasy Epic (I know, it sounds awesome.) The book is part of a two trilogy saga with narrations from the different main characters, in this case The Wielders.What's the book about?The story is set in the fantasy land of Eretria, to know more about the back-story of the book you can go up and see the video. The book follows two stories. The first one is about Valent, the brother of the new Wielder of Rih and bender of the air. He will assume his role as a Wielder when the current one dies. Valent always lived under the shadow of his brother, but a life changing encounter with a deadly curse will reveal his true identity as the Dragonborn, Wielder of the power of Dawl. The curse, instead of killing him, gives him visions about his future and what will happen if Dlam returns. He has to start a journey to assume his new identity and find the person who cursed him.The second storyline is about Kella, the next Wielder of Ilma and water. After an encounter with an unknown creature known as a Malikore, she discovers the return of another dark being. A Warlock who fought for Dlam during the great war is alive and looking for Dlam's soul shards to bring him back. She travels to the frozen lands with the current Wielder, Kallin, to defeat the Warlock before he is able to summon Dlam back.The book changes narrative between Kella and Valent, showing two different sides of the greater story about to be unveiled. While Valent discovers more about his identity as the Dragonborn, Kella tries to stop the Warlock from taking the first shard. Eventually they both meet and realize that in order to stop Dlam's return they need to find the other Wielders.I want to give backThere are a lot of kids out there who don't have the money or means to get a book and start reading, this is why I am donating 20% of the money I'll raise with this campaign to Books for the Barrios. This is a charity that gives books to third world country kids so they may enjoy the gift of literature. As I mentioned before, I grew up in Costa Rica and even though we it is a tropical paradise for foreigners, it still is a third world country. I have seen kids living in terrible poverty and teenagers in social danger because of this, I know that this charity can help them and take them away from a bad future by showing them a world they can escape into through books.   What I need the money for: To illustrate this better I made a pie chart, because they make stuff look smarter and simpler. Note: The target is $8500,  the extra $700 goes to indiegogo for hosting the campaign.-The editing is the most expensive part because it is the hardest one, it consists on proofreading the book for grammatical errors and then copy-editing the book to help with the flow.-The cover design is a very important part of the book since it will attract the attention of potential buyers. I want to hire a professional graphic designer to create the front and back cover along with the book spine.-Marketing is another huge part for future sales, this way I can get the people to know the book by creating a press release, getting reviews, creating a book trailer and a big social media buzz to make the book known.-The donation is pretty straight forward, I know that with such an amount of money the charity will make hundreds of kids happy with new books.-This may be the most puzzling one but I do have to pay for the AWESOME perks I'm giving to you. This covers the cost of the physical perks and the international shipping.    The Impact There is no life changing impact on this project since it's a book. But there is a cultural impact to it, I was raised among books instead of TV. They provided new and different worlds to escape into. Nowadays you see kids waiting for a book's movie instead of reading it. I want to give the kids and teenagers something to enjoy with words instead of images, something that will have them sitting down for hours and make them fall in love with reading. And even though it's a Young Adult book, I believe there is no age for it, whether you are 14 and reading it because your friend told you to or 40 and reading the book for your kids, I know books are something for anyone to enjoy regardless of their age.How do I know the book is good and not just a 350 page piece of crap?This is the most important question for the backers, knowing if the book they are paying to publish is good or not. If you want to read the first six chapters of the book (They are unedited right now so it's not the final product) you can send me an email to nc.lawrence.writing@gmail.com and I will send you a PDF for you to read and make sure you like what you're paying for.Extra Goals-Any extra money will be split between donations and a more marketing and reviews.   Other Ways You Can Help Money isn't the only help you can give. If you're an editor or graphic designer and want to give free help I would totally welcome it.

story:
Short Summary

We are Ben & Julia, a young couple from Oxford, England who are passionate about cooking and sustainability. Cooking together is our favourite way to spend an evening. Often this was from recipe books which although created great tasting food left us with excess ingredients that would end up being thrown out after not knowing what to do with them.

This led us to think differently about recipe creation. To rethink the way we cooked and began our journey to creating this cookbook that not only shares some of our favourite recipes, but is able to teach others what we've learned about zero waste cooking. We can't wait for you to join us on our sustainable cooking journey!

As two young-professionals we are unfortunately not able to go to print straight away. Therefore, by becoming a Rethink Cooking contributor in this campaign, you will be the reason that we can actually print and get our cookbook self-published! Something that we have dreamed about since starting this project a year ago.

As a contributor you will receive recognition in the book and may even have the opportunity to have a recipe named after you! 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise a minimum of £800 to get our first set of books printed.

If we are able to have more than that fundraised, we will be able to print extra books that can be sold after our campaign ends which would be incredible!

If we are not able to reach the fundraising goal, you will still get your cookbook, however it will unfortunately mean that we'll have to dip into our personal savings to get the books printed which is not ideal!

To ensure that we are able to reach our goal, we have put together a list of perks for those that invest in us! These include:

  • Recognition in our cookbook thanking you for making this happen!
  • Access to our newsletter with updates on the book's progress and exclusive recipes!
  • Rethink Cooking merchandise that can be purchased alongside the cookbook or individually! These include stickers, mugs, aprons and more!

The Impact

Although many may think that this is "just another cookbook" we see it as far more than that. One-third of all food produced is thrown away. Of that 70% comes from the household. This food waste then produces 6% of the world's greenhouse gases. These are damning statistics that have to change as soon as possible.

The Rethink Cooking cookbook will be more than just a set of recipes. It will be the beginning of many people's zero waste journey with tips and tricks on how to reduce your food waste at home, and showing that everyone can enjoy their favourite meals in a sustainable way. 

It's not about one person reducing their food waste perfectly, it's about everyone doing imperfectly.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge will be the distribution of the cookbooks. This is going to be an international affair with the books being printed in Julia's home country of Canada! We want to make sure that no matter where you are in the world you will be able to get a copy of our book. 

Our other challenge is to get the books printed and distributed before Christmas. We are currently in overdrive working our hardest to finalise everything and are hoping that by the end of October they should be ready to go to print. If we are not able to get the books to you by Christmas however we will be sending out exclusive Christmas menus and other gifts to ensure you are getting your moneys worth. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We completely understand that not everyone will be able to purchase a book or contribute financially. We therefore would love it if you could share this campaign with friends and family, and get the word out to everyone would be interested in what we are doing!

The more noise you can make about the campaign, the better!

You may even receive this as a present if you send this as a hint to a loved one! ;) 

Much love, Ben & Julia xx

story:
Our Story

   Hi!

   I hope you liked the little clip. We live in a world where no one wants to grow up. The roots of Neverland run deep. Childhood is amazing and it was once just a fleeting life stage. Now, thanks in part to Peter Pan, the pinup boy for people who never want to grow up, childhood is available as a permanent lifestyle choice but there is a cost for having children parent children, for putting perpetual boys in charge of companies and countries and for leaving young people to self initiate. ‘Leaving Neverland’  weighs up the costs, delightfully skewers perpetual boys and offers contemporary Rites of Passage as a timely way out of Neverland.

The book 'Leaving Neverland' is complete and a generous preview is available from the "Leaving Neverland' website. I am here on IndieGogo for support to pay for press releases and to promote the book to libraries and retail outlets. I would also like to pay for a series of animated clips about Peter Pan in the 21st Century. I hope you find this project one worth supporting. It is a book with an important message.

   “Behind every preventable threat to the future of the human race stands a boy in a man's body with both of his hands in the cookie jar set aside for future generations.”

   Whether that threat is building Nuclear power plants near fault lines, oil spills in the Gulf of Mexico, GM food, the Global Financial crisis or climate change the behaviour behind each disaster is one of childish greed and selfishness coupled with short term thinking and a total lack of responsibility or compassion for the resulting social and environmental devastation. There are a few movies that are starting to highlight this phenomenon e.g.  'Inside Job,' 'Company Men,' 'Avatar' 'Capitalism a Love Story' 'Enron the Smartest guys in the Room' and 'Confessions of an Economic Hit Man' (a book but some great author interviews on YouTube).

       My name is Daniel Prokop. I've been around the block a few times, nearly 50 times if you call one year a block. I've worked at a senior level for the largest company in the world, I've run my own business and I have worked for a harm prevention charity; three vastly different sandpits all linked by similar childish behavior, some of it my own.

    I didn't really start to grow up until I was unexpectedly faced with becoming a dad at the age of 32. I almost said "this is too hard" but somehow I got my head around fatherhood and I have loved being a dad, loved it. I didn't want my son to wait until he was 32 to start to grow up which is why I became involved in contemporary Rites of Passage. [A Rite of Passage is simply a supported event or ceremony that marks the transition from one life stage to another e.g. from child to young adult, man to father, woman to mother, older to Elder and death.]

    Rites of Passage once provided the link between physical body growth and emotional growing up. Find out more about this by reading the book.

   I have spent the last two years writing and working on promoting 'Leaving Neverland' and prior to this I was working for a harm prevention charity. I am a self published author and I am finding it very difficult to get this book and the message out there without an advertising and promotions budget.

    'Leaving Neverland' will soon be distributed via Lightning Source which will make it available in paperback on a Print on Demand Basis to readers as well as book stores and Libraries in the USA, Australia and the UK which is exciting. It is already available in Kindle and all eBook formats and what I need now is some financial support for PR and promotion.

    I would love your help to make this happen, for our sake ffs (for our futures sake) it is time to leave Neverland.

The Impact

     If you are tired of the little boys clubs that run many parts of the economy, if CEO's that are vastly overpaid on a strict 'take no responsibility now, take no responsibility later' basis make you sick then I invite you to read this book and support this initiative. If you are a parent and you want to know what you can do to help your children to grow up emotionally then please read this book and let other parents know about it too. Parents play a huge role in whether their children ever grow up emotionally.

     One of the messages of this book is that we need to stop giving respect and power to the Peter Pan's who are unaccountable bullies that have confused aggression and domination as signs of strength (amongst many other foibles which I describe.) If they behave like children we need to treat them like children and many of these besuited infants have not played nice and need some time out.

The world is changing very rapidly, contemporary Rites of Passage can quickly become a core plank of a revolution in education that would be timely. We have left our young people to self initiate for centuries too long and the consequences are all around us. We really, really need healthy adults in charge more than ever.

“In a desperate attempt to stay young forever we have achieved eternal childishness, rather than eternal youth.” 


What We Need & What You Get

I would like $4,800 to pay for publicity and the production of additional animated clips. Indiegogo is a fabulous initiative. As a supporter you can get anything from a $5 Neverland Pass Out to E-books to signed paperback copies of the book to the Leaving Neverland Talk. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about "Leaving Neverland" (Why Little Boys Shouldn't Run Big Corporations) and remember to use the Share tools and like 'Leaving Neverland' on Facebook.

story:
Well, after an extremely tumultuous week, it looks like I am in fact moving to Alabama to hang out with my big brother and his wonderful wife for a little while!  That move doesn't come cheaply.  I hate asking for money but I could really use the help.  I set up some perks that I think are pretty awesome for all different donation levels!  Every dollar helps and will not go unused!

Help this gent get into a white suit with mint julip in hand!

story:
La Novela

En medio de una brutal crisis que golpea con fuerza las ciudades de Nueva York y de Jersey, y que ha provocado un gran aumento de la mendicidad y la delincuencia en los últimos años, el investigador de la policía, Johnny Jumper, se ve inmerso en una operación de narcotráfico, en la que parte de la mercancía acaba en las manos equivocadas; y en el asesinato de una joven de clase alta en Central Park, que las autoridades quieren que se resuelva rápidamente.

El Autor

Jorge Fontana Jordán de Urríes (Madrid, 1983) es licenciado en Economía por la universidad Autónoma, y ejerce desde hace doce años como controlador de gestión y analista financiero en una multinacional del sector de la automoción. En 2016 se trasladó a las afueras de París, época que coincidió con su incursión en el género negro como escritor.

El rey de Jersey es su primera novela.

Una Muestra

«Le imito apoyando los antebrazos en el frío metal. Mirada perdida hacia delante. Enfrente tenemos el puerto de Brooklyn. Se ve movimiento de barcos y grúas bajo los potentes focos de luz que emanan las torretas laterales. Nick se seca los ojos discretamente. Lo veo de refilón sin necesidad de girarme. Dejo que se desahogue.
          —En esos años difíciles me metí de todo. Los precios se fueron a la mierda —me dice recuperando su tono normal—, como lo de todo lo demás. Mercados financieros incluidos —sonríe con nostalgia—. Y claro, para conseguir pasta he trapicheado mucho. Que en realidad es lo que hacía antes —dice levantando las cejas—, lo único que esto es ilegal y lo otro no…
          —De trapichear a narcotráfico de ocho toneladas de coca hay un trecho.
          Expulsa aire por la nariz de golpe a modo de risotada corta.
          —Pues sí, pero es mucha pasta también. Con esto podré empezar de nuevo… Recuperar a mi familia… —duda después—. Bueno, no, que les den por saco a todos. Sobre todo a mi mujer… Al perro en cambio sí que le echo de menos —dice riendo abiertamente por fin.
          —Esto te queda grande de cojones, Nicky.
          —Bueno —me dice mirando hacia el barco—, somos muchos. Y muchos están… estáis preparados.
          —Tú no sabes una mierda de mí —le digo con un gruñido seco».

El Objetivo

En esta campaña preventa nos hemos propuesto alcanzar el equivalente a 55 reservas, es decir, 880€, recibiendo quienes participen el libro en su casa sin gastos de envío (en España) antes de que entre en circulación... existiendo incluso la opción de reservar el libro con tu nombre en los agradecimientos por un poco más del precio de venta, como detalle exclusivo.

También, usando la opción BACK IT, podéis realizar donaciones a la edición; opción a través de la cual no se os pedirá dirección de envío porque no conlleva contraprestación de ningún tipo.

Media

Por otro lado, independientemente de que colaboréis realizando vuestra reserva o no, en ocasiones no se puede, sería una inestimable ayuda que os hicieseis eco de esta campaña a través del boca-oreja o por redes sociales... la Cultura, Distrito 93 y Jorge Fontana os lo agradeceremos.

story:
I Am Very Proud to be in Partnership with International Women's Day!

This is the perfect book to celebrate International Women's Day as it is about a woman who makes a difference in life. I hope that this book will inspire other girls and women to do what they can to make a difference for the good! 

We Can All Make a Difference

I'm Marcia Goldlist. After learning religious education and curriculum planning I was a religious school principal and a family educator. I have since retired, although my writing and grandchildren keep me very busy! Enjoying the Book of Esther: The Bible in Rhyme will be my 7th book. Two of my other books are also in The Bible in Rhyme series. You can check out all of my books on my author page.

This book is especially important to me because it is a story that can really speak to all of us. Whether you are religious or secular, young or old, familiar with the Bible or not, this story is about life. Esther is a story about a person who is put in a situation where she can make a difference. At first she refuses. She is afraid. Her uncle, who raised her, told her that perhaps she became queen for just this opportunity to help her people. Probably no one reading this will become queen, but we all have opportunities in our lives to help others and perhaps we were put in our situations in order to help these people. It is my hope that this book will inspire people to use their lives for good.

By helping with my campaign – by contributing money and/or passing on the details – together we can inspire people to look for opportunities in their own lives in which they can help others. I offer you perks for every budget - from $2 to $500 - and every contribution helps!

Do check out my $500 contribution because it gives you an opportunity to inspire someone to make something of his/her life, or to thank someone for making a difference in your life.

Where is the Money Going?

I always try to keep costs down, but I do have expenses:

  •  Bible scholar to check the accuracy of my work
  •  Editor
  •  Cover Design
  •  Publicity
  •  Marketing

My project is environmentally friendly, I only print the number of books sold.

A Sampling of Perks

I'm offering perks for every budget so I hope that you can help out!

My favorite perks are: 

  • $2 - Receive a summary of the book of Esther in rhyme by PDF
  • $500 - Receive a full page dedication in the front of the paperback edition. Plus 5 free books to pass around.

*Please add the shipping cost to the amount being contributed if applicable.


Be sure to check out all the perks! 

By the way, you are allowed:

  • to donate to more than one perk 
  • give more than the amount listed

How Do You Know That I Can Deliver?

As I wrote earlier I have already published 6 books. You can take a look inside each of them on Amazon through my author page and read a few chapters for free. So, I know what needs to be done and I know that I can carry through. In fact, I have started to help others publish books.

The Impact

I believe that together we can make a difference!

We can spread the word:

  • People can use their situation for the good.
  • You don't have to be religious to enjoy the Bible.
  • Bible can be meaningful for everyone.
  • There is now a fun, understandable, easy way to read Bible!

So, please spread the word about this campaign and contribute money if you can!

Don't forget to use the indiegogo share tools!!!

story:
Treasure Map To Your Soul

After 20 years of this starlit passion for the stars planets and astrology, the star surfer, Azlan White, is requesting your support of her life-full of astrology wisdom, being distilled into a simple book guiding you to your own personal treasure map!

Because of Azlan's current state of independant self-employment through astrology filled with volunteer positions, she requests your support to publish her first and most important astrology book ! A real treasure map! (to your soul)

Would you be willing to donate $35-$1000 to help her achieve a small dream?

Publishing a Book in today's world is so much easier than ever before!  With your help, Azlan can publish her first astrology book.

Here's where your money goes: $16,995.50 + processing fees = $17,800.00

$5,540. (Tom BIrd's Publish NOW Program) Every detail of the publishing process--managed! www.TomBird.com Includes: style editing, editorial managing, sheparding and mastering full completion across a broad spectrum of salable products of all the book variations possible, including audio, hardback, softback, and every form of digital reader available on the market. Saturating the market with my book, so every book buyer can find it, is a way of accessign a "best seller list."  As a team, we're aiming for making me what is called a "best seller." If i achieve this, YOU will have succeeded in being part of another miracle.

I feel (already, since i'm already in the Tom Bird author's coaching system) sheparded through every step, corner and detail, from writing, to editing, to style editing, to support to complete cover art and get it up, SEO optimization, etc. The care in the details of every step . . marketing, support for every single tiny detail required in cultivating a best-selling book with the tools that are available.

Tom, Rama and their team have allowed me to show up to retreats as a mentor, and continue to receive the support of the publishing program webinars--without paying anything additional after my first retreat--revealing--its roots in a large heart. I still owe a little money on that first retreat to Loren at BODY of Santa Fe. Thank you Loren for your patience. Your debt is covered in this campaign budget, at $300 if i raise the full amount.

Tom Bird and his team has raised my spirits to keep writing, whenever i can squeeze it in!  They are inescapably magical in my life!  I am so so grateful to this gifted collaborating team! I can't say enough good things here without boring you!

I invite you, especially if you've ever wanted to write a book before, to join myself as an ally or cheerleader, and Tom Bird as an authors coach, in one of his retreats coming up in the fall or next year! Let me know when you'd like me to join you for the retreat and we'll make it happen!

Because of Tom Bird, I've re-ignited my passion for writing and a level of enthusiasm about teaching "beginners," my passion and mastery: Astrology in a way that is real. Since Tom has led me to speak to "the everyday brick layer." I've found his author's coaching, invaluable for my own self-disciplinning, completion, and writing mastery.  i feel blessed to have achieved more mastery over writing and publishing, in small and large ways in his 3 day retreats. Whenever i go--i make miracles out of myself. In that i'm reaching to put vast concepts into simplifying and distilling words for the "every day brick layer."

What a gift. To be supported in every phase of publishing all the way to ensuring the best technical equipment on the web to secure any and all sales, no matter how large or small the flow at once. . . . . . what more could a reluctant closet author ask for?

$1,200  "One Shopping Cart," managing the technical side of online booksales, (monthly service for a year).

These sales will take place on an independent website related to the book itself. One Shopping Cart is the most secure reliable shopping cart on we can set up digitally, according to an author who sells over 30 books on the web, and has tried every system known to man.

$1,520 Specialized Website Design designed to make sales of the book, in all of its forms.


$500 Estimated Lighning Source Press Setup costs for softback adn hardback books

$575 Attending Tom' Bird's Sedona Retreat as a mentor this August:  this amount includes food costs, gas, travel and supporting me to live in my automobile for Tom's Retreat at the end of August. If you'd like to explore being there, call Rama or Tom Bird's office, www.TomBird.com

$6000 Living Costs for 6 months to complete the revision, style editing and formatting of the book! I'm deeply grateful for your support so i can focus my time and energy on the book itself.

$1,000 debt repayment fund - supports me to make small payments in areas where i have personal debt with individuals who have helped me along the way.

$60 : ISBN registration ($30 per title), paper and hardback makes two

$ 300.50 telecommunications support - a landline payment for doing Treasure Chest Astrology Readings! (one of the special gifts available here as a benefit for supporting the publication of this treasure mapping soul-book! )

Your Support of this Treasure Chest Book, will not only assist Azlan in fulfilling a dream and miracle--it will also fuel the movement to end Female Genital Mutilation in Africa through www.GlobaReliefResources.org

With financial success, Azlan will pour herself into this work and the non-profit she directs: Global Relief Resources (Grr Inc.)

Ways You Can Help:  Please pass the word!  &  use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
1 in 3000 children born each year have a genetic mutation that expresses as Neurofibromatosis. Approximately half of these children are the first in their families to have it. A parent with Neurofibromatosis has a 50% chance of passing it on to his/her children. Because it expresses itself from mild to severe, many parents don't even know they have it until their child is diagnosed.

For parents, the diagnosis is often devestating due to the lack of resources to provide reliable information and the uncertainty of their child's future. Some children will be relatively unaffected; others will face multiple surgeries before they enter Kindergarten.

For children, as they become more aware of their bodies and their differences, there are often many questions: questions about what's happening to their bodies now and what might happen in the future.

 

“Mommy?” aked E,

As a child of three,

“Why do I have spots all over me?

“Because you’re my leopard child,”

She replied with pride.

“You’ve got strength and agility inside.”

 

This book aims to provide information for parents, answer children's questions in a reassuring way and ultimately to act as a vehicle for families to discuss the diagnosis with their child.

The book will be provided free to parents through genetic counselling centres, health partners and NF support societies. The author and illustrator are both donating their time and skills. The funding requested is to print and ship copies to partners throughout North America. We are hoping to raise enough funds to print and ship at least 2000 copies. A pdf of the book will then be provided to NF supports in other countries so that they can print their own copies.

About the Author and Illustrator

Dara Squires

Dara Squires is a syndicated parenting columnist, freelance writer and social media consultant. She is also the mother of a child with Neurofibromatosis. With a background in health literacy and a passion for reaching other parents, she decided to initiate this project to fill a major gap in resources.

E is Emerson, her youngest son, who is fortunately blessed with few complications from Neurofibromatosis thus far. He's her wild, leopard child and the inspiration for this story.

www.readilyaparent.com

Brian C Carter

Brian Carter has over eight years professional experience in graphic design, specializing in print and pre-press; seven years experience with software development, user interface design and database administration; two years professional experience in illustration, animation and game design.

This will be Brian's first children's picture book. He has enthusiastically agreed to donate his time and skills to further this project.

brianccarter.com

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can't afford to make a donation right now. That's fine! But if you think this project is as worthwhile as we do, the donation of your time is just as valuable. Share this campaign with your friends using Indiegogo's convenient share tools. Contact local media to tell them about the project. Get the word out!

story:
Perennial

In my AP English Language class last year we read Virginia Woolf’s “A Room Of One’s Own”, and as I read, one quote inexplicably changed the trajectory of the next 5 months of my life, “Lock up your libraries if you like; but there is no gate, no lock, no bolt that you can set upon the freedom of my mind.” This quote started my 5-month, 84-page, 4759-word journey to creating Perennial.

During the first month of writing poetry I read “The Road Not Taken” by Robert Frost, a poem widely misquoted. Initially, I thought it could be about two roads diverging in the woods, but now I believe it could just be a metaphor. By the second reading, I realized it was not about taking “the road less traveled”. As I interpreted it, Frost regretted this decision, wondering if he should have returned at any given moment. By the fourth reading I realized there’s no definite answer, and I loved the ambiguity. I used to look at poetry and think of how pretentious it sounded, and how it had to be in Shakespearean English to be acceptable. I later realized I had become annoyed when friends referred to poetry as Shakespeare’s love sonnets, clearly disregarding Edgar Allan Poe’s breathtaking “Annabel Lee”. This became one of my biggest breakthroughs; poems have the inability to be confined into one form. 

Not long after, I took pride in my work, knowing not all writing had to be structured in iambic pentameter. I learned that with free verse I had the freedom to write myself into history, even if it was just my own. So, a year ago I bought a sketchbook and made it a habit to write every day. After crafting a poem I transcribed it onto my computer. At one point I was so hysterical I kept my journal on my bedside, just incase there was a fire. You could say the fear of living my life without leaving a single trace behind motivated me to write a book. 

On the other hand, I am motivated to keep a journal as a way to be able to speak to my children long after I’ve passed. Words have this incredible notion of not aging, which would make me frozen in time. In Virginia Woolf’s “A Room Of One’s Own”, she tackles topics that are still relatable to this day. She debates the idea of women being inferior to men; inequality is widely comprehensible today. Think about it this way, she’s a woman that died long before I was born and she’s talking to me; I am reading the words she wrote nearly 85 years ago. Which means that books will continue to impact people, and the beautiful works of poetry I’ve read by Nayyirah Waheed, Sarah Kay, and Rupi Kaur will permanently shape the way I view life. 

As time passed I developed this habit of ordering 8 to 10 books of poetry at a time. These books, however, did not feed my ravenous desire for poetry. Shortly, writing became as easy as looking out a plane window, getting an idea, and writing it down on my sketchbook.

Ultimately, I titled my book Perennial meaning perpetual, everlasting, recurrent; unlike other styles of writing, poetry is the one that has left a lasting effect on me. Writing has sparked my love for learning, yet there’s room to improve because Sarah Kay perfectly describes in one sentence what I’ve been trying to convey in 650 words,  “So no matter that I have inhibitions to fill all my pockets, I keep trying, hoping that one day I’ll write a poem I can be proud to let sit in a museum exhibit as the only proof I existed.” 

This book has made me the person I am today. It has helped me through issues I never imagined as a child I would have to deal with. If I hadn't written these thoughts down I would still be dwelling with myself. This is why I want to publish my book. I want teens that have been through what I have to know that they're not alone. I want this book to resonate with people; I want it to connect with anyone who wants to read it. I don't want others  to have the same boundaries I once created for myself. My goal is to get 2,000 dollars in order to make around 100 copies of my book. However if I don't reach that goal I will still publish the books I can with the allotted money. Know that 25 dollars help me publish one of them! Please help me get my thoughts out there, help my story be heard! Share this if you can! Thank you.

Carla Sofia Barjan.

story:
Short Summary

Hi. I'm Hannah Miller. I am good at writing Utopian literature (it's been documented in Politico, for godssake), and I am writing a book based on the society of Burning Man. Burning Man is a punk-rock Rainbow Gathering and a whole lot more.

There aren't a lot of Utopian writers anymore, and like reverse-Orwell, most of the stuff we write is dark. But you have to see deep in there to appreciate Utopia in the first place, right?

Burning Man is the ultimate oracle. Whatever you want to see, whatever you want revealed, will be revealed to you. So I am writing a book about the people who create Burning Man, and the environment that is created by their devotion. It's spiritual - in a beautiful, cramped, half-assed 21st-Century American sort of way.

This book should be very good, and may or may not include any of the following elements: fire, water, dust, drugs, apocalypse, nudity, life/death nexus, confusion, boredom, primal fear and joy, a total loss of meaning and/or numbness at high altitudes, lots of putting up and taking down of tents, and most importantly, an underlying, unspoken, group commitment to hope.

Here is, in fact, a preview, from the Burning Blog, which I wrote last year:

http://blog.burningman.com/2014/04/afield-in-the-world/burning-land/

Alberta is a vast cold pine forest in central Canada. The largest city, Calgary, is so perfectly snow-covered that it once hosted the Winter Olympics, and the regional Burn there is held on an elk farm in the summer. The elk wander around, gazing at the otherworldly lights from the darkness of the forest and probably wondering what’s going on. The regional is called Freezerburn, and it is so far north that the sun comes up at 4 a.m.

I met a sound engineer from Alberta at the Global Leadership Conference this year. He belongs to a camp called Space Gnomes, and is asked by fellow campers to “fix the sound,” meaning to redirect sound waves.

Most of the time, flat speakers broadcast, sending sound waves in all 180 degrees; he focused the waves on certain areas, on a dancefloor, in one direction. That works for high frequencies, but “bass is more omnidirectional,” he said.

“So bass waves spill more,” I said.
“Basically,” he said.

http://blog.burningman.com/2014/04/afield-in-the-world/burning-land/

 

Why I Need Donations!

I need gas money to get to all these events. It's THOUSANDS of miles, in multiple states, and although I am doing this cheap, it's going to take at least two months during which I can't work very much.

 

The Impact

No one has written about the regionals like this - Danger Ranger (who has already helped me along with many, many other people) did a pass about ten years ago, and went around in a self-supplying-psycho-mental-device called the Silver Seed documenting the impulse. I want to write more of it.

If you are a Burner: you already know how difficult it is to translate your experience for your non-Burner friends. I have been a journalist for ages, and I intend to bust my ass until I figure out how to do it.

If you are not a Burner: Hey Americans! I don't need to tell you that we live in the most cynical, depressed, apathetic media culture that has ever existed on Earth... which discourages participation, community, and creativity, the very things that sustain the human spirit. This book is the little oxygen mask that drops out of the ceiling of the airplane when it starts to crash. You know what to do in case of an emergency, right?

    Risks & Challenges

    Indiegogo advises here that I talk about the risks and challenges of this project.

    Hm.

    Well...compared to, say, the austere perfection of a Stendhal novel, my book could suck.

    But that's probably unlikely. I've had a lot of book ideas before that I didn't pursue because they were insufficiently complicated or interesting. I will probably hate it because I'm a perfectionist, but you'll probably love it!

    Insofar as the challenges go, don't worry about those. I'll figure them out.

      Other Ways You Can Help.

      So tell me - who should I write about?
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hi. I'm Hannah Miller. I am good at writing Utopian literature (it's been documented in Politico, for godssake), and I am writing a book based on the society of Burning Man. Burning Man is a punk-rock Rainbow Gathering and a whole lot more.
There aren't a lot of Utopian writers anymore, and like reverse-Orwell, most of the stuff we write is dark. But you have to see deep in there to appreciate Utopia in the first place, right?
Burning Man is the ultimate oracle. Whatever you want to see, whatever you want revealed, will be revealed to you. So I am writing a book about the people who create Burning Man, and the environment that is created by their devotion. It's spiritual - in a beautiful, cramped, half-assed 21st-Century American sort of way.
This book should be very good, and may or may not include any of the following elements: fire, water, dust, drugs, apocalypse, nudity, life/death nexus, confusion, boredom, primal fear and joy, a total loss of meaning and/or numbness at high altitudes, lots of putting up and taking down of tents, and most importantly, an underlying, unspoken, group commitment to hope.
Here is, in fact, a preview, from the Burning Blog, which I wrote last year:
http://blog.burningman.com/2014/04/afield-in-the-world/burning-land/
Alberta is a vast cold pine forest in central Canada. The largest city, Calgary, is so perfectly snow-covered that it once hosted the Winter Olympics, and the regional Burn there is held on an elk farm in the summer. The elk wander around, gazing at the otherworldly lights from the darkness of the forest and probably wondering what’s going on. The regional is called Freezerburn, and it is so far north that the sun comes up at 4 a.m.
I met a sound engineer from Alberta at the Global Leadership Conference this year. He belongs to a camp called Space Gnomes, and is asked by fellow campers to “fix the sound,” meaning to redirect sound waves.
Most of the time, flat speakers broadcast, sending sound waves in all 180 degrees; he focused the waves on certain areas, on a dancefloor, in one direction. That works for high frequencies, but “bass is more omnidirectional,” he said.
“So bass waves spill more,” I said.“Basically,” he said.http://blog.burningman.com/2014/04/afield-in-the-world/burning-land/
 
Why I Need Donations!I need gas money to get to all these events. It's THOUSANDS of miles, in multiple states, and although I am doing this cheap, it's going to take at least two months during which I can't work very much. 

The ImpactNo one has written about the regionals like this - Danger Ranger (who has already helped me along with many, many other people) did a pass about ten years ago, and went around in a self-supplying-psycho-mental-device called the Silver Seed documenting the impulse. I want to write more of it.If you are a Burner: you already know how difficult it is to translate your experience for your non-Burner friends. I have been a journalist for ages, and I intend to bust my ass until I figure out how to do it.If you are not a Burner: Hey Americans! I don't need to tell you that we live in the most cynical, depressed, apathetic media culture that has ever existed on Earth... which discourages participation, community, and creativity, the very things that sustain the human spirit. This book is the little oxygen mask that drops out of the ceiling of the airplane when it starts to crash. You know what to do in case of an emergency, right?

Risks & Challenges
Indiegogo advises here that I talk about the risks and challenges of this project.
Hm.
Well...compared to, say, the austere perfection of a Stendhal novel, my book could suck.
But that's probably unlikely. I've had a lot of book ideas before that I didn't pursue because they were insufficiently complicated or interesting. I will probably hate it because I'm a perfectionist, but you'll probably love it!
Insofar as the challenges go, don't worry about those. I'll figure them out.


Other Ways You Can Help.So tell me - who should I write about?

story:
Funding is now over, thanks to those who contributed! It really means a lot to me!

If you would still like to order a copy, you can do so HERE.


UPDATE: I just posted an excerpt over at Buzzfeed.

My name is Jamie and I am 28 years old. I grew up in a strict, conservative household so my life has been uneventful. That is, until I started touring full-time in 2009 (Madina Lake and Steel Train). Since then, I have been to 47 states in the US and have been to over 15 different countries.  I went from being a geeky kid people picked on in elementary school to a nomadic, vagabond lifestyle tour managing, kicking kids off stages, pushing gear in the pouring rain, all while living with at least 6 other guys in a crowded van (or 15 in a tour bus).

This book is about the last few years of my life and will contain stories of my experiences and how I've grown up throughout and because of them. 

I am planning to have the book in your hands or iPad or Kindle or Nexus 5 by mid-January. Most of the book is written, it just needs some fine-tuning before I can publish it. Your contribution will help with:

  • Cover art design
  • Copy Editor
  • Book layout
  • Recording the audiobook
  • 1st run of books
As a contributor, you will get updates and also excerpts of the book as time goes on. 

Thank you so much for taking time to check this page out even if you can't contribute. I just ask that you help spread the word because every Facebook status update, tweet, e-mail, etc. helps. Mahalo. 

You can also follow me on Twitter for updates.
